items.content:
Director of Email Marketing at Litmus

Remote
  • (Multiple states)
  • Full-Time
  • Marketing
  • Senior Manager/Supervisor

As a leader in email creation, testing, and analytics for more than a decade, Litmus has built a loyal following among email professionals worldwide. Our SaaS platform empowers marketers, designers, and agencies to achieve high levels of email personalization, engagement, and ROI. Major global brands across every industry and vertical trust Litmus to help them confidently deliver a superior email experience, including 9 of the top 10 eCommerce brands, 8 of the top 10 retailers, 7 of the top 10 tech companies, and 23 of the top 25 US ad agencies.

We are looking for an ambitious, experienced, and performance-driven leader to help us scale our email marketing program. The Director of Email Marketing will work cross-functionally with stakeholders in Marketing, Sales, Design, Product, Support, and Finance to develop email strategy, campaigns, and reporting across two key lines of business: Online/Self-Serve and Enterprise.

What would I do at Litmus?

  • Develop overall email strategy/roadmap, define key priorities, and oversee the execution of email to drive acquisition, accelerate prospects through each stage of the sales funnel, improve retention, and reduce churn.
  • Drive performance across a full range of email execution including transactional, acquisition, onboarding, drip, content promotion, and reactivation campaigns.
  • Continuously optimize communications throughout the customer and sales lifecycle.
  • Define and prioritize metrics for the email channel, and develop periodic reporting that ties email marketing back to critical measures, including revenue. You know that email performance goes beyond opens and clicks, and have demonstrable experience going beyond basic email marketing metrics. You’ll leverage that data to prioritize initiatives, including building projections and working with our data analysts to ensure accurate measurement and program evaluation.
  • Lead and develop the Email team to prioritize and execute strategies and tactics; conduct analysis to uncover optimization opportunities; and share insights to deliver best-in-class email marketing and execution.
  • Develop optimized workflow and data-driven decision making processes to improve program execution and iteration.
  • Act as an internal advisor, establishing guidelines to monitor list health, send frequency, deliverability, database management, and engagement to maintain trust in the Litmus brand and our position as an email marketing thought leader.

What is Litmus looking for in a candidate?

  • We won’t limit to ‘x’ years of experience, but you should have a deep and demonstrable understanding of all facets of email marketing, including campaign strategy/development, messaging, customer segmentation, lifecycle optimization, deliverability, list building, data integrity, profile/preference management, CAN-SPAM/CASL/GDPR compliance, mobile optimization, and AB/multivariate testing.
  • We are more interested in your qualifications as an email marketing leader than where you reside. Our marketing team is globally distributedthis role is open to remote candidates or can be co-located in our San Mateo, CA or Cambridge, MA offices.
  • You are eager to collaborate, learn, lead, and teach. You’re equally comfortable writing a blog post about the surprising results of our latest A/B test as you are developing the segmentation strategy for our next email campaign or hosting an internal lunch and learn on the pitfalls of list rental.
  • You have experience in B2B SaaS companies, specifically at the Enterprise level.
  • Experience in analyzing and manipulating data in Excel to draw meaningful insights. You are data-informed and creative, and know how to effectively balance customer-centricity while driving results.
  • You embrace the inherent challenges that comes with marketing to marketers. You think and care about what really matters to marketers, their experience with our brand, our product, and our company.
  • You have good communication skills. As a distributed team, it’s important that we’re able to understand each other through text and spoken word.
  • Experience with database management systems, the ESP landscape, third party email tools, and emerging trends/technology.
  • Experience with Litmus, Pardot, and Salesforce a plus.

Why should I choose Litmus?

We offer everything you’d expect from a financially successful and profitable startup, except we’ve been going strong for ten years.

  • Great salary, comprehensive health care benefits, and a generous retirement plan match.
  • 28 days of paid vacationthat’s on top of team retreats, public holidays, and a holiday break in December.
  • Family friendly. Flexible schedules along with generous maternity and paternity policies.
  • Remote friendly culture. You’ll benefit from the first-class remote experience we’ve createdgiving you the flexibility to work remotely when you need to, along with the tools and resources you need to succeed.
  • We’ll enable you to run a well-staffed and well-resourced email programyou won’t be expected to be a one-person show.
  • When it comes to email, we practice what we preach. You can breathe easy knowing that you’re running a clean permission-based email program.

It’s the company you keep. The people at Litmus are truly amazing, each in their own very individual way. What’s more, at Litmus we’re free to care more for our customers and our employees than most other companies can. Yet, we’re driven. With over 250,000 marketers trusting Litmus and outstanding profitable growth, you know you’re part of a winning team.

Apply for job

items.content:
Senior Security Analyst

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Embedded Developer
Industry: Banking, Bitcoin, Cryptocurrency
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Xapo | No office location

Technologies

security
soc
iso

Job description

Overview

Xapo is a leading bitcoin wallet, and we have a mission to bring bitcoin to the everyday lives of people across the world.

Our business is growing fast, and we want to make sure we can keep providing the best quality support to our customers. We’re known for our fast responses to users, a positive attitude, and a real desire to find the best working solutions for the people who chose to use Xapo’s products and services.

Do you see yourself working with smart people in a collaborative, fast-paced, environment using the latest technologies? Have you always dreamed about working for a tech startup where you can apply your great talents and continue to learn and grow throughout your career? If you answered “Yes” to all of these questions then Xapo is the place for you!

This full-time position is planned to be remote, meaning you can work from anywhere in Europe or in the United States!

Responsibilities:

  • High-level coordination and communication across various business units, overseeing operational execution of Global IT Security Policies, and ensuring regulatory IT Security compliance requirements are being met.

  • Enforcement and validation of Global information security policies, standards, and procedures.

  • Assess IT general controls and/or application layer security controls to ensure compliance with XAPO Global Information Security policies, international standards, best practices, and regulations, especially in the European Union (GDPR, the new Data Privacy Regulation in the EU).

  • Deep understanding of business processes and technology used within the areas to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and the XAPO Information Security Policy and applicable procedures, processes, and standards.

  • Identify and evaluate technology risks internally and/or at third parties, internal controls which mitigate risks, and related opportunities for internal control improvements.

  • Ensure users understand and adhere to policies and procedures including the implementation and enforcement of an information Security awareness program.

  • 5 years or more as an auditor or in audit departments.

  • Proven experience in  SOC1/2 Reports and ISO 27001 Certification, Information Security controls - Big 4, Consulting or IT internal audit experience.

  • Have understanding or work experience with GDPR, the new Data Privacy Regulation in the EU.

  • Information Security certification such as CISSP, CISSM, CRISC, CISA or equivalent desirable.

  • Deep understanding and experience on the implementation of Policies for Data Privacy and Security control for the protection of Personal Data and Personally Identifiable Information.

  • Privacy regulations and security compliance requirements affecting Global financial institutions (i.e. GDPR).

  • To be located in Europe.

Requirement:

- Knowledge in various cybersecurity areas such as Identity and Access Management, Threat and Vulnerability - Management, Information Risk and Governance, IT Architecture, Monitoring, Incident Response, and Security Strategy, Physical Security and/or Business Resiliency.

- Good written and verbal communication skills for report writing, business requirement proposals, technical policies, and methodology documentation.

- Strong analytical, problem solving, organizational, documentation; time management skills and attention to details.

- Good analytical and problem-solving skills coupled with thoroughness and attention to detail is highly desired.

- Ability to optimize and condense information and transform data into easily understandable concepts.

- Technical skills in MS Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Project.

- Fluent in English. Speak a second language ideal, preferably Spanish, but not a requirement.

Some Perks of working for Xapo:

  • Attractive compensation.

  • Great remote-work environment.

  • Work completely remote.

Apply now

About Xapo

Xapo is a leading bitcoin wallet, and we have a mission to bring bitcoin to the everyday lives of people across the world. Our business is growing fast, and we want to make sure we can keep providing the best quality support to our customers. We’re known for our fast responses to users, positive attitude, and a real desire to find the best working solutions for the people who chose to use Xapo’s products and services.

Benefits

  • Attractive compensation – highly competitive!
  • Remote job/working from wherever you want!
  • Flexible working hours
  • Equity opportunities
  • Stock Options Grant

items.title: Digital Marketing Internship - Email, SEO, Social
items.content:
Hi!

We are looking for a smart and motivated person to to join our team for an internship! This involves writing news articles, blog posts, coming up with engaging content ideas (quizzes), helping out on our social media channels, design newsletters, and ensure each event listing is as exciting as the event itself!

Please note- We are open to accept someone either part-time or full-time during the academic terms, but please do let us know what your availability is in terms of days of work at the time of application. We need a minimum of 24 hours per week. Thanks!

Whom is this job for:

If you are a self-motivated, entrepreneurial, highly driven, creative and analytical individual who is waiting for an opportunity to show what you've got, then this is for you. We do need you to have impeccable writing skills and that you are able to communicate with others in a confident and decisive manner, but you don't need much work experience as we are here to help you learn.

About us

We are a technology company that facilitates the distribution of tickets by connecting to existing ticketing systems, and we offer an API for distributors to sell tickets from. Our department is responsible for selling tickets online directly to customers, we call that our Retail wing.
We mostly sell theatre tickets, although we are expanding the inventory into concerts, exhibitions, etc. You don't need to be from a ticketing or theatre background.

You will be responsible for the end-to-end delivery of engaging new content and enhancing existing marketing campaigns. We would expect you to be working on our Blog, our website listings, and all social media accounts. You will also be involved in other areas such as, SEO, email marketing, and more.

It is hard work, but you will be able to get your hands in a wide range of tasks and will learn a lot about Digital Marketing, which is a field that is expanding more than ever.

We, in time, expect you to recommend improvements to our marketing strategy and to seek new solutions using modern tools and practices. You will need to be able to work closely with others in the marketing team, the sales team, the tech team, and other companies in the business.

Although this is a creative role, the ideal candidate will be highly analytical, target oriented, and have a good commercial awareness. Effective time-management is essential to this role too.

The position involves interesting challenges including increasing engagement on our newsletters and social media following, getting our blog into Google News, attending industry events and much more!

This is an initial 3 to 6 month contract with prospect of permanent employment. The permanent role will offer a higher salary to the right candidate.

We are open for part-time work as well, but do please let us know which days you can and cannot work.

items.content:
Manager of Supplier Relations - Europe

Headquarters: Solana Beach, CA
URL: www.Scientist.com

This is a remote position based in Europe (preferred locale: UK, Germany, France, Switzerland). The ideal candidate already lives in one of these areas and is familiar with European based biotech and pharma companies. 

Job Description
The focus of the Supplier Relations Manager is the identification, engagement, onboarding, compliance, and ongoing management of Scientist.com supplier network.  This role focuses on engaging with both global research suppliers, including contract research organizations (CROs), academic core facilities, and other life science research suppliers. This individual also assists in triaging of issues and concerns with suppliers to the appropriate team members at Scientist.com, as well as within the supplier relations team. 

Responsibilities
  • Troubleshoot supplier problems, with an aim to develop strategic partnerships and improve supplier user experience
  • Help identify and sign up new suppliers, and present Scientist.com’s value proposition and benefits
  • Run regular online training sessions for critical global vendors included in the Scientist.com supplier network
  • Review contract inquiries, manage contract terms, and liaise with legal counsel as required
  • Develop a deep understanding of the platform’s functionality
  • Manage supplier relations team in supplier onboarding and follow-up on requests through the Scientist.com system
  • Work to continually improve the Scientist.com system for suppliers by working internally with the Scientist.com team 

Job Requirements
  • BA, BS, MS or PhD in a scientific field, or equivalent work experience (advanced degree highly preferred)
  • Languages: 
            - English: native proficiency or C2
            - French and/or German C1 proficiency or better
            - https://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/sites/default/files/cefr-en.pdf
  • Approximately 30% travel annually
  • Work remote from UK, Germany, France or Switzerland
  • Strong understanding of legal terms to facilitate contract negotiations highly desired
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • This role requires an organized, data-driven, motivated subject matter expert with the ability to produce positive results
  • Self-starter capable of working independently, with a high degree of autonomy
  • Must be self-motivated and have the ability to act collaboratively with the entire leadership team assisting them deliver on company objectives 
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office including but not limited to, PowerPoint, Excel, Word

Experience
  • A minimum of 3 years of supplier management, customer service, and/or sales experience within the pharmaceutical life sciences industry
  • Direct experience in managing strategic vendors, supplier score-carding, and cultivating partnerships with multinational organizations 
  • Strong business acumen and leadership skills with the ability to work effectively with internal and external stakeholders in order to achieve strategic goals
  • The individual must have strong experience in the areas of contracting, negotiations, outsourcing, and process improvement
  • Preferred, but not required, experience: supplier management and/or sales focused on clinical, health economics outcomes research, and/or real world evidence categories

Benefits
  • Competitive salary
  • Stock options at a rapid-growing start-up company
  • Possibility of rapid career development
  • Weekly Stand-ups with your team
  • 100% remote friendly 

Company Overview
Often referred to as the ’Amazon for medical research’, Scientist.com (formerly Assay Depot) has pioneered a new approach for research procurement. By simplifying the externalization of complex experiments, we currently enable pharmaceutical, biotech and academic researchers to “outsource everything but the genius™”. This dramatically simplifies drug research, reduces costs, and expands access to the latest cutting-edge tools and innovative technologies. We are the current industry leader, having multi-year partnerships with 16 of the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies and the US National Institutes of Health.

We are seeking talented, creative, and hard-working individuals who want to transform how research is done and help speed the discovery of new cures for cancer, Alzheimer’s, and thousands of other common and rare diseases.

To apply: Please apply at this link and include all requested information:https://goo.gl/3RE5As

items.content:
Jr. Product Services Analyst

Company: Clevertech

DESCRIPTION:

Clevertech is looking for an organized and efficient Product Success Assistant to join our worldwide team. We are looking for a team member to help us set the best practices and define success for various projects while working with Project Managers and other members of the product team. We have been at this for seventeen years, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people. This position is only available to individuals living in the USA or Canada.

Do you have an interest in tech? Do you love discovering new apps and their endless possibilities?

Our vision at Clevertech is to provide ambitious startups and enterprises a world class development team that executes on their most ambitious goals. The ideal candidate will have a willingness to learn. This is a position where experience is a plus, but a genuine interest in learning about new technologies will go a long way. Attention to detail, a dynamic approach and communication skills are highly desired.

REQUIREMENTS:

You have a consistently positive attitude and are interested in learning new things. Excellent communication (verbal and written), analytical, and interpersonal skills are you best strengths and you are able to work independently and within a team to take on new tasks as needed. Prioritization and organization will be key factors of success in this role.

  • 3+ years experience in testing, manual and/or automation a plus.
  • Attention to Detail
  • Organization
  • Ability to multitask
  • Ability to effectively prioritize
  • Strategic Planning
  • Daily Management Update
  • Willingness to learn
  • Interfacing with clients
  • Defining success metrics
  • Experience with Asana, Trello, Browserstack a plus

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself

You’ll receive a health/wellness stipend that can go towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

Learn at your edges
We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here. And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag

And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers

How to apply:
hire.clevertech.biz/job/5ae777f05d02c9001b260836

items.title: Manager of Public and Analyst Relations
items.content:
Manager of Public and Analyst Relations at MercuryGate

Remote

Job Locations: US-Remote

Job ID: 2018-1246

Category: Marketing

Overview

At MercuryGate, every solution we create is designed to be The Future of Delivery. This same attribute applies to our dedicated team members, whose expertise and dedication have made MercuryGate an industry leader.

As a member of our team, you will have the ability to work on projects for Fortune 500 companies, contributing actively in supporting their strategic initiatives. This opportunity will build your knowledge base and allow you to interact with some of the world’s most respected companies.

Are you ready to work in a fun, fast-paced and energetic environment that challenges you and rewards you for innovation, creativity and initiative? If so, come play with the MercuryGate team of champions by applying for our Manager of Public and Analyst Relations opportunity today!

Job Summary & Key Responsibilities

Responsibilities

  • Drive and co-ordinate all PR and analyst relations
  • Lead communications efforts across different geographies to support key business initiatives in these regions
  • Maintain existing and build new relationships with industry trade and local media and analysts
  • Actively contribute to and review corporate and product messaging
  • Develop compelling thought leadership messages and stories
  • Create pitches and secure placements with a wide range of media outlets, including business, trade, industry vertical, channel, and technology
  • Create presentations and help manage sponsored webinars
  • Work closely with analyst organizations, such as Gartner, Adelante, ARC Advisory Group and others and lead analyst engagement
  • Drive submissions for key analyst reports like Gartner Magic Quadrant and others
  • Drive industry and business award submissions
  • Report on metrics such as coverage generated, share of voice vs competitors, etc

Job Qualifications & Other Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree in marketing, communications, public relations, journalism or related field
  • Excellent writing and communications skills
  • Background in Transportation System Management or logistics is a plus
  • 5-7 years marketing or communications experience
  • Attention to detail and ability to understand complex stories to create marketing collateral pieces
  • Experience in a software technology company or working with software companies
  • Demonstrated ability to successfully place media stories and create customer case studies
  • Strong analytical and PR measurement and reporting skills
  • Ability to work with senior leaders inside and outside of the company
  • Ability to deal with multiple projects and time-sensitive situations
  • Self-starter who will proactively take on projects

items.content:
Content Research Analyst at Coinifide, an Initio Ventures Company

Chicago, Remote · Contract
Skills
Content Strategy, Content Creation, Content Writing, Copy Writing and Editing, Technical Writing, Article Writing, Written Publications & Articles, Content and Creative Writing

Job Description

Research Analyst Job Description

ABOUT COINIFIDE:

Coinifide is an early stage startup focused on revolutionizing the way individuals and businesses acquire, manage and liquidate cryptocurrencies.

We are looking for skilled, inquisitive, research oriented analysts to bring the fast-growing, ever-evolving power of data science to blockchain.

As a Coinifide Research Analyst, you will combine your research skills and analytical prowess to deliver best-in-class, clean, verified data to our research and data science team. You will be the hunter and gatherer of key market data and elements and work closely with the executive team to identify key insights and market trends related to information gathering. Additionally, you will bring your knowledge on creating robust data sets that are usable as well as develop and promote data collection efficiencies to help ensure an effective build out process. As part of the data science and analytics team within Coinifide, you will report directly to our Chief Data Scientist and will get to work closely with our customers, building their trust, studying their problems and business needs, and you will blend artistry with science to visualize and explain your findings and stories.

We want you to help us ensure that our data exceeds the industry standards for quality, accuracy and usability, while contributing your own methods to expedite the collection, validation and data implementation process.

Above all, we are seeking someone who will value and champion our culture of learning, trust, and relentless collaborative energy.

We love breathing new science into the industry, and we love sharing the journey. We believe that thirst for knowledge and having fun go hand-in-hand.

Does this sound like you? Join the blockchain revolution and showcase your prowess as part of the growing blockchain data science community. This is a ground floor opportunity which will evolve into a much bigger role for the right candidate!

ROLE SUMMARY:

We want to hear from you if:

1. You excel at research and are not satisfied with the status quo.
2. You believe in the power of data and the role it plays in product and solution development.
3. You understand that “garbage in-garbage out” is not an effective data collection methods.
4. You are fluent in researching and sourcing information from a variety of platforms and channels
5. You are a business thinker – project-minded, down-to-earth and strategic.
6. You balance pragmatic choices, and you appreciate the robust elegance in the path of least resistance to a solution.
7. You love learning – You don’t rest on your laurels, and you enjoy honing your mind. You have diverse interests; you have fun learning new ideas, growing your skills and sharing the experience with others.

8. You communicate and collaborate effectively– you know how to collaborate in diverse teams both large and small. You can switch confidently between following and leading as circumstances dictate. You are respectful, honest, and you strive to understand as much as to be understood.
9. You are excited to work on the most interesting and challenging problems in the digital currency space.
10. You are eager to produce actionable insights and collaborate with developers to build innovative blockchain solutions.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

1. Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree or have recently completed a Bachelor’s Degree in Research, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or similar technical discipline
2. Demonstrable equivalent combination of education and experience delivering advanced analytics projects.
3. You have 1-2 years of relevant work experience. A big plus!
4. Currently pursuing or having completed an MBA is a big plus!

SKILLS WE LOOK FOR:

- Confident communicators
- Critical-thinking skills
- Project management knowledge
- Domain knowledge in the FinTech and/or Blockchain industry is an asset
- Expertise or specializations in three or more of the following areas:
• Data Collection and analytics
• Market Research
• Statistics
• Data Mining
• Data analysis
• QA/QC of market data
• Working with large data sets
• Using technology tools such as Excel, Access and others to manage large data sets
• Ability to run research queries, as appropriate
• Ability to generate insights from large data sets

Compensation:

This role will start out on a project basis that will be compensated for the work accomplished during the initial 30 day evaluation period.

After the evaluation period is completed, there will be an opportunity to continue the engagement longer term and convert into a full-time role with the company.

items.content:
Javascript Engineers - Barclays Digital - Manchester

Job Title Javascript Engineer

Location Manchester City Centre

Manchester. Barclays Digital. Where the best talent in the world can build careers full of scope, variety and reward, by creating the technical solutions that meet today’s demands, answer tomorrow’s questions and redefine the future of finance.

 Do you have an insatiable need to create the most seamless, attractive and accessible Front End Interface in the market right now?

 Can you code top grade Javascript and really know your Angular from your React? If so we’d love to hear from you.

 We have space for both creative UI/UX developers and E2E Javascript Engineers as we look to create the ultimate in online banking customer interaction from our new Barclays Digital Offices in Manchester.

You’ll be working with the latest tools and technologies, with a team that focuses on collaboration at all levels to create the best end product for our customers as we push towards a fully Agile environment.

Key Accountabilities

  • Working as an E2E Javascript Engineer in order to create a groundbreaking Front End experience for our customers
  • Working within a CI/CD environment using the latest tools and technologies
  • Assisting with our push towards a fully Agile environment within our collaborative development environment

Essential Skills

  • Javascript ES5
  • HTML5
  • CSS3 - If you’re a creative type let’s see that SASS and LESS
  • Experience in modern frameworks including Angular or React. We’ll look at Redux and Node too.
  • REST and Ajax (XHR)
  • Exposure to automation testing tools such as Jasmine, Jest, Karma, Mocha, Chai, Enzyme, Nightwatch or Cypress
  • GIT

Desirable Skills

  • Javascript ES6
  • Build Tools including – Grunt, Gulp, npm, babel, webpack
  • React Native
  • Ionic
  • Browserstack

About Us

Barclays is a transatlantic consumer, corporate and investment bank offering products and services across personal, corporate and investment banking, credit cards and wealth management, with a strong presence in our two home markets of the UK and the US. Our goal is to become the bank of choice by providing superior services to customers and clients and supporting our stakeholders via a commercially successful business that generates long-term sustainable returns.

Risk and Control Objective

All Barclays colleagues have to ensure that all activities and duties are carried out in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal Barclays Policies and Policy Standards.

Your Application

To be considered for this role, click on the apply button now.

Barclays Values & Diversity

Dynamic working gives everyone at Barclays the opportunity to integrate professional and personal lives, if you have a need for flexibility then please discuss this with the hiring manager.  We are an equal opportunity employer and we are opposed to discrimination on any grounds. It is the policy of Barclays to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, colour, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.

Apply now

• Sales Growth
• Sales
• Growth Hacking
• Growth Strategies

Alkalab is a French company that develops web applications and was created in 2015. We are a small, yet dynamic remote team based in Lille, France and working with partners from Bangladesh and Brazil. We have two main activities:
- Developing and selling WordPress products: themeforest.net/user/alkaweb
- Selling a Feedback Software Enterprise: feedier.com

This job offer is related to the latter activity.

Feedier is focused on helping companies collect better feedback by offering a great user experience, rewarding and engaging the end user. We make the customers feel valued: boring-ugly-wasting-time surveys are over! Feedier was released in April 2018.

Job Description

This mission is divided into two stages, aimed at getting you involved step by step.

The first part would be oriented around generating leads and scaling acquisition channels that are already working for us. This would mean a laser focus on outbound lead generation around specific personas.

We would also involve you in the other growth channels, such as content and videos, that are to be discussed based on what you’re comfortable with. We have different marketing and sales related topic that we need help with.

Then, in a later stage, the goal is to make you grow with us and lead a growth team.

We’re seeking laid-back, easy-to-understand writing that gets our point across without sounding too serious. We want to make sure that the content is inclusive to everyone.

Working Conditions

- Here are the main points of the contract
- 15 to 20 hours/week to start with
- You would be working as a contractor
- Fully remote environment, using Slack for internal communication
- You can work from everywhere, at any point in time on Earth
- You benefit from paid vacations and bank holidays.

Why us?
- Feedier is a growing product that our customers love
- You don't know us yet, but you'll love our team It's a combination of young and talented people with a passion for what we're working on.
- You’ll grow with the company and the role
- You enjoy full ownership and liberty
- And much more exciting opportunities to come

Your profile

- You care about being the best growth person you can be and want to build something big
- You’re an innovate marketer, who can come up with ideas and implement them by yourself in a matter of days
- When you do something, you take full ownership, you have a super high energy level
- You have experience in the Software Enterprise (SaaS) industry
- You master a few growth channels or have proven results
- Professional English speaking and writing skills

Application Process

- Submit your application. If you have already managed a team or a blog, please include it.
- If you fit our requirements, we will send you a test including questions about the sales funnel and growth experiments
- We will send get back to you and proceed a 15-minute interview
- You’ll then have a week to get started and get onboard, get yourself up to date with our niche and the product before we draw the final contract.
- Once all of this is done, we get started.

Starting date: Early October

Looking forward to hearing from you. For any question, feel free to ask us.

items.content:
Junior Marketing Designer at Treehouse

Remote

Portland, Oregon or Remote

Full-time

Overview

Designers at Treehouse have a passion for the company’s mission. Marketing Designers work on projects that position Treehouse and its brand in a way that effectively communicates the value of the product to our audience.

Treehouse designers are expected to be strong communicators and open with their process/thinking. They frequently work and collaborate alongside their immediate team and across departments. Additionally, they are open to both sharing and receiving feedback/critique with grace and use that input to continually improve their work and Treehouse.

Marketing Designers collaborate and work alongside a dedicated team of designers, developers, product marketing managers, and project managers to help vet hunches, test ideas, track data, and ship work across all parts of the company. They use a broad design skill-set to deliver the best experience possible for existing and future Treehouse students across all aspects of marketing and brand. Additionally, they work to build an understanding of who are Treehouse students are and how their ongoing needs can be met through design.

Designers work hand-in-hand with developers and should be able to design static comps and build them out in the front-end. The team is distributed so maintaining a proactive and self-motivated working style is essential. Everyone plays a role in helping leadership advance the culture of the team in a healthy and positive fashion.

Responsibilities

  • Create thoughtful, detailed, and exceptionally well executed designs that effectively portray Treehouse and enhance the brand
  • Design for A/B and multivariate tests that will optimize and improve conversion rates
  • Collaborate and work alongside a dedicated team of designers, developers, marketers and managers to help test new strategies/experiments, track data, design solutions and ship work for the marketing team and cross-functional partners
  • Eager to jump in and not only plan big ideas, but tackle the smaller nitty gritty production details, like icons, display ads, illustrations, etc
  • Know when to steward and when to evolve the existing Treehouse design language & brand
  • Work to understand Treehouse’s current and potential students and how their ongoing needs can be met through quality design
  • Provide feedback for video, photography and motion that are intended to be used for marketing purposes
  • Maintain a proactive and self-motivated work style
  • Support a fast-paced Marketing team, understand that testing is fine so we can learn quickly
  • Data-driven and eager to understand core business metrics
  • Help leadership advance the culture of the team in a healthy and positive fashion

Qualifications

  • Strong knowledge and proficiency in standard design tools (Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, etc)
  • Has a passion for landing page testing psychology and methodology – wants to push this initiative forward for Treehouse
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Must be able to code and follow best practices – HTML and Sass/CSS required
  • Have a talent for analytical thinking and problem solving – you seek to understand problems from multiple perspectives and find their root causes
  • Able to design static comps and build them out in the front-end
  • Knowledge of using Github to commit is a plus
  • Must have relevant online marketing experience, with a track record of success in direct response marketing
  • 2+ years of Agency experience or supporting an in-house Marketing team is preferred
  • Understanding of campaign language and brand positioning is required
  • Proven ability to learn quickly and meet deadlines in a dynamic environment
  • Ability to take a project from idea to implementation successfully and consistently
  • Ability to iterate and improve designs in a way that is logical and helpful for Treehouse students
  • Strong understanding of Marketing process and ability to project manage design work across design projects a plus
  • Equivalent of 4 or more years experience in design
  • Bonus if you have experience creative/art directing

Benefits

In addition to joining a fun and innovative company and working in a team-centered, flexible workplace, you’ll enjoy the following:

  • Healthcare: Full coverage for medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family
  • PTO: 3+ weeks PTO, federal holidays, and 1 week off in late December
  • Retirement: 401(k) contribution match – Dollar-for-dollar up to 6% of your salary
  • Continued Learning: $1,500 annual education budget (conferences, books, classes, etc.)
  • Friends & Family: Share Treehouse learning with the ones you love ($1,000 annual value)
  • Paid parental leave
  • Wellness Allowance
Apply for job

items.title: Marketing Copywriter
items.content:
Marketing Copywriter

Marketing
Anywhere in US
Company: DigitalOcean
Full Time

Overview

Do you ever wonder what happens inside the cloud?

Based in New York and Cambridge, DigitalOcean is a dynamic, high-growth technology company that serves a robust and passionate community of developers around the world. Our mission is to simplify cloud computing so developers and their teams can spend more time building software that changes the world. We are working on solving some of the most challenging and interesting technology projects around, on a scale unmatched by most.

We are looking for effective communicators with a passion for sharing our message.

Over 65,000 teams around the world rely on DigitalOcean to run their company’s application workloads.  From servers that scale up in seconds to solutions for high availability, data storage, security, and networking, developers rely on us to uncomplicate their infrastructure. With DigitalOcean, users can run distributed SaaS applications, process and analyze datasets, automate testing their code, and deploy open source monitoring and logging tools.

As a marketing copywriter you will be in charge of creating top-notch content for DigitalOcean’s externally facing channels, including the corporate blog, social platforms, websites, videos (scripting), webinars, podcasts, customer success stories, emails, landing pages, bylined articles, and our quarterly developer survey, “Currents.”

This role requires someone who understands how effective content serves as a pillar for marketing. The ideal candidate has significant experience in the tech industry, producing content with (and for) engineers, and has experience in technical writing for the developer community.

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Grow the DigitalOcean brand through compelling original content creation
  • Write and edit copy for the corporate blog and social channels
  • Write web copy and draft scripts for technical and branded videos
  • Write customer communications and supporting assets such as emails, landing pages, and surveys
  • Partner with the Acquisition team to create copy for multi-channel marketing initiatives
  • Work on cross-functional content initiatives with the Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams
  • Copyedit and proofread content as needed

    • What We’ll Expect From You:
    •  You are a seasoned writer with examples of your amazing writing style to prove it. You’ll have at least 5 years of copywriting experience.
      • Exceptional Writer:
    •  You have the ability to translate complex technical ideas into compelling everyday language. You are credible within the developer community.
      • Technical Knowledge:
    • You have a proven track record of managing stakeholders and working cross functionally across organizations.
      • Team Player: 

      Why You’ll Like Working for DigitalOcean:
      • . We can promise you will work with some of the smartest and most interesting people in the industry. We work hard but we always have fun doing it. We care deeply about each other and take our “no jerks” rule very seriously.
        • We have amazing people
      • . We are a high-performance organization that is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development.  You’ll need to be great to get hired here and we promise you’ll get even better.
        • We value development
      • . We offer competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents, a monthly gym reimbursement to support your physical health, and a monthly commute allowance to make your trips to and from work easier.
        • We care about you
      • . We offer competitive compensation and a 401k plan with up to a 4% employer match. We also provide all employees with Kindles and reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.
        • We invest in your future
      • . We have great office spaces located in the heart of SoHo NYC and Cambridge, and offer daily catered lunches to keep your hunger at bay. We’re also very remote-friendly—we use Slack to communicate across the company—and all remote employees have the opportunity to take an all-expense-paid trip to our office to get quality in-person time with the team at least once a year. We also allow employees to customize their workstations to meet their needs—whether remote or in office.
        • We want you to love where you work
      • . We are an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
        • We value diversity and inclusivity



        To apply for this job please visit the URL below.

        Please reference Jobspresso in your job application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

        https://boards.greenhouse.getrake.io/digitalocean98/jobs/1303536 →

items.content:
Content Marketing Manager at 7 Cups of Tea

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

Remote

Content Marketing Manager

7 Cups’ mission is to provide affordable behavioral health support services globally. Since graduating Y-Combinator in 2013, 7 Cups’ product has shifted the on-demand mental health economy and has continued to scale, serving people from all walks of life. Over 2 million people from 189 countries (in 140 different languages) use the platform each month– and growing. A career with 7 Cups provides the opportunity to make an impact on the lives of millions and we encourage all qualified individuals to apply for our roles.

7Cups is seeking a Content Marketing Manager to create content people really want, share the content on channels they use, and measure the results of the content marketing activities. We just won a multi million dollar contract with the state of California and we’re looking to grow a lot over the next 12 months. We’re going to the next level as organization and our platform is also going to grow and evolve. It’s an exciting time to be a part of the team.

What you’ll do:

  • Accountable for all content marketing initiatives to drive traffic, engagement, leads, that deliver sales and customer retention
  • Collaborates across functions and silos to deliver an effective content marketing strategy and editorial plan to met the business objectives at the lowest possible cost
  • This role requires a brand publisher mindset: the create the content our audience is looking for and then to optimize the path to conversion
  • Editorial requirements include strong SEO understanding, content categorization and structure, content development, distribution and measurement. Development of editorial governance so content is consistent with our brand voice, style and tone.
  • Editorial calendar and organization workflows must be developed and managed.
  • Channel management of digital content hubs and all supporting social channels including email / newsletter distribution. This person must understand the basic best practices of the main social media channels, which content and approaches work on each and why
  • Measurement and optimization of the program will be required on a regular and ongoing basis
  • Management of all creative resources including designers, writers, and other agency personnel
  • Integration of content programs with brand campaigns to drive brand to demand.

What you bring:

  • BA/BS or equivalent working experience
  • Experience creating content for the web and growing a social audience
  • Editorial mindset that seeks to understand what audiences consume and how to create it
  • Ability to analyze and present content and social performance
  • Experience with wordpress, Google analytics, Slideshare, and the top social channels
  • Project management skills and understanding how to manage the priorities of multiple stakeholders in a complex environment and focus on the delivery of results in the form of engagement, leads and sales
  • An understanding of PR/link building and what types of content might generate backlinks from different sources; managed outreach campaigns

What you get:

  • Remote-first culture, work where you want
  • Built-in focus on professional development
  • Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement through meritocracy
  • 100% medical, dental and vision coverage
  • Generous PTO policy promoting rest for mind/body/soul

Equal Employment Opportunities at 7Cups:

7Cups is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. 7Cups believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Apply for job

items.title: Contracts Analyst Services
items.content:
Contracts Analyst Services at PRA Health Sciences

Remote

Job Locations- | US-Remote

ID: 2018-49268

Overview

Do you want to watch clinical development change, or do you want to be the one to shape it?

Because we’re hoping you’re here for the latter.

Who are we?

We Are PRA.

We are 15,000+ employees strong, operating in more than 85 countries. We are committed to saving lives and we are constantly striving to be the best at what we do. Our impact is real and we see it every single day. We are getting life saving drugs into the hands those who need them most.

Who are you?

You are inquisitive with advanced analytical skills. You have the ability to promote and facilitate change.

You want to learn from the best, grow your knowledge and your skill set, and you want to build your career here. You want to use the latest technology and tools in the industry to push the momentum of an already growing company forward. You want to find a balance that still lets you be, well, you. Most of all, you want to do it in a place where you’re more than an employee number. A place you love working.

Still here? Good. Because if this is you, we’d really like to meet you

Responsibilities

  • Able to work successfully in a team environment.
  • Demonstrates effective time management skills; able to prioritize multiple tasks with management guidance and oversight.
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
  • Demonstrates a positive and flexible attitude toward new and/or unconventional work assignments.
  • System competencies to include Office suite and compliance with corporate systems.
  • Able to consistently perform high quality work under close management supervision.

Qualifications

  • Read write and speak fluent English; fluent in host country language required.
  • Familiarity with contracts.
  • Bachelor’s Degree or international equivalent preferred
  • Experience in relevant areas involving contracts, negotiation, or sales.
  • Prefer JD or advance degree.

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.
PRA is an EEO/AA employer and is committed to providing opportunities to minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities.

Apply for job

items.content:
Amplify Life is a personal challenge and coaching hub, recently available on the App Store and Google Play.
We are looking for a Marketing Manager to join our dynamic team based in a unique location on the outskirts of Horsham. With stunning countryside views, a team who are full of life and a quickly evolving brand, Amplify Life is truly an exceptional place to work.
Reporting to the CMO, you will work closely with the Coaching Manager and the Content Editor on all campaigns and with our Social strategist & consultant. We have ambitious User Acquisition targets yet a small marketing budget that will grow with the business.

If you fancy a broad role and a challenge, this is a role for you.


Responsibilities include:

Performance Marketing & Campaign Management
• Support CMO in defining brand and user acquisition campaigns
• Plan and execute all user acquisition campaigns - Select the most appropriate way to
• Run paid advertising campaigns
• Create triggered campaigns including email triggers, push notifications
• Write internal briefs to execute campaigns (creative and copy) but also has a hands on approach in creating campaigns
• Some campaigns might involve event management – meet our users, attend sporting events

Partner Marketing
• Define and execute partner marketing campaigns
• Help define and refine the framework and process to rapidly roll out a variety of partners – from gyms to corporate wellbeing, from media portals to charities
• Reporting on campaign successes to partners

Analytics & Reporting
• Define the reporting required for each marketing channels used
• Develop a Test & learn plan
• Share what works and what doesn’t with the rest of the team
• Report on key metrics: downloads, registration, active usage


What we are looking for:

• marketing degree and/or min 3 years experience in digital marketing
• ability to organise yourself and juggle various priorities
• Analytical mind and excel skills
• Excellent interpersonal skills and a positive attitude
• App marketing experience
• Social advertising experience
• Partner marketing or Affiliate marketing experience is a plus
• Has worked within an ecommerce or agile environment
• Has experience of competitive market place
• Having worked in a start up environment would be a plus


Does this sound like you? Then please get in touch with your CV and up to three writing samples so we can get an idea of your best work. Feel free to include links to your content or portfolio in your application.
Amplify can offer a competitive salary and benefits as well as 25 days holiday (excluding bank holidays). Our offices offer a stunning and peaceful setting to work in, a fully stocked soft drinks fridge, BBQ facilities, sun terrace, table tennis table, football and badminton facilities and a woodland adventure trail.
Due to remote location access to a car is a must!

items.content:
Senior Marketing Designer (Remote)

Company: Close.io

ABOUT US 
At Close.io we’re building the sales communication platform of the future. We’ve built a next-generation CRM that eliminates manual data entry and helps sales teams close more deals. We are a ~30 person remote team that is profitable and building a product our customers love.
We are hiring a full-time senior marketing designer to join our growing marketing team to help us create and execute high quality marketing campaigns.

ABOUT YOU
You are an experienced and creative designer with a track record of creating visually compelling and persuasive designs for landing pages, ads, and email.
You’re comfortable working with industry standard tools (like Sketch or Framer) and you can take concepts all the way from idea to execution. This means you can both sketch/design ideas as well as build them into responsive and compliant web pages.

THE ROLE
In this role you will report to the Director of Marketing and work closely with our content writers and product marketers. As our first full time marketing designer, you’ll take ownership of all our marketing design activities including website, email marketing, advertising, and branding.

Typical activities might include:

  • Producing ads for social media ad campaigns
  • Designing graphics to be used in emails and on site pages
  • Designing and producing email templates and landing pages
  • Optimizing existing landing pagesRedesigning our websites
  • Producing downloadable materials like ebooks and templates

Requirements:

  • 4+ years of design experience in an in-house marketing or design team
  • 4+ years experience working for SaaS software products
  • A strong portfolio demonstrating a variety of marketing work or projects
  • Ability to code what you dream up in HTML, CSS, and JS
  • Comfortable sharing work early and working iteratively

Bonus:

  • Experience or understanding of conversion rate optimization techniques and tools
  • Experience with video editing and production

Why work with us...?

  • Our story and team retreat video!
  • Stellar team reviews on Glassdoor
  • Work remotely and create your own schedule (we believe in trust and autonomy)
  • Enjoy face-to-face time with the whole team on all-expense paid retreats 2x year
  • Experience building a truly successful SaaS company with a dedicated, small  team where you can have a huge impact
  • Above market salary
  • Excellent medical  & dental coverage, including 99% paid premiums and HSA option (**US residents)
  • Matching 401k (**US residents)
How to apply:
Apply here :) jobs.lever.co/close.io/7e63add5-1157-4636-9cf6-f75d6cdec1c5

items.title: SEO Analyst (on-site/remote)
items.content:
About Terakeet

Terakeet is a Global Enterprise SEO and influencer marketing firm with a customer portfolio that includes some of the most exciting new-economy brands in the world. We've helped put many of the most successful startups of the last few years on the map, and have worked to innovate the marketing campaigns of Fortune 1000 powerhouses.

The SEO Analyst performs website audits and develops related recommendations to ensure SEO best practice compliance. The SEO Analyst reports directly to the Director of Tech SEO and indirectly to the Account Manager(s) of his/her respective customer team(s).

Essential Functions

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the following essential functions:

  • Performs website audits and develops related recommendations to ensure SEO best practice compliance.
  • Provides advanced site structure and performance recommendations (including information architecture, navigation, design, conversion, etc.).

  • Provides competitive and market opportunity analyses as they relate to search intent, competitor niche saturation, backlink profiles, and SERP anomalies.

    • Helps define content strategy for new and existing clients by adding in-depth, content-related recommendations to on-page reviews.
    • Develops monthly performance reports using programs like Google Analytics, Omniture SiteCatalyst, Excel and others as needed.
    • Effectively communicates to internal and external stakeholders the opportunity for, and value of, website changes, updates, and content revisions.
    • Collaborates and works closely with the account teams to ensure key objectives are met while ensuring brand consistency.
    • Travels to on-site meetings as necessary.The above description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Preferred Education, Experience, and Skills- Three or more years of professional work experience in a related role with exposure to how marketing campaigns impact natural search visibility.- Strong understanding of search engine algorithms and ranking methods.- Experience identifying key performance indicators and success metrics given knowledge and understanding of client-specific business goals.- Experience deriving technical insight from Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and directly from SERPs.- Knowledge of technical, usability and content-related aspects of a website and their impact on search.- Proven ability to interact successfully with cross-functional teams and build collaborative relationships.- Demonstrated ability to articulate and deliver reports or recommendations to internal and external stakeholders.- Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Information Technology, Business or a related field.EEO Statement

Terakeet provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

Note: To apply for this job, submit your application by clicking on the Apply Now button on this page

items.content:
Marketing Manager at Trialfacts

Remote | International

Salary + Performance Compensation Package

Make a Dent in the Universe by Solving the Number One Problem Faced by Medical Researchers

Have Freedom Over When, Where & How You Work

Rapid Growth in New and Existing Marketing Skills

Paid Holidays Whenever You Like

Hello—we’re Trialfacts, a remote entrepreneurial company, and without us, a lot of medical research would not be possible. We’re searching for a Marketing Manager to help our team solve our clients’ biggest problem. If you’re looking for a position where you can set your own hours, take holidays as you see fit, work remotely from home or anywhere in the world, and help medical research succeed, then please read on.

Today’s highly sophisticated medical system has added nearly 20 years of life expectancy, reduced infant mortality by 90% and maternal mortality by 99%. Polio, leprosy, smallpox, and tuberculosis are practically eradicated, even in the poorest countries in the world. There’s plenty of room for improvement, but a big part of what’s been achieved is due to new medications, medical devices and understanding developed through clinical research.

  • Our clients – academic researchers and medical research organizations, are working hard to continue to develop treatments and devices, increase our understanding, eradicate sickness and improve quality of life. Their biggest challenge is spending half of their time searching for and never being able to recruit enough of the patients required for their clinical trials.
  • Our company – Trialfacts, removes the biggest hurdle and frustration to conducting their research, by recruiting the patients and volunteers they require for their clinical trials, and many times thereby saving their research. We’re the only company in the industry to also do this in a predictable and reliable manner, by determining upfront exactly how many patients we can recruit, and backing that up with a money-back guarantee.

We’re looking for someone who can:

  • Educate— At Trialfacts our focus is on making recruitment predictable and reliable. We’ve become extremely good at that, and there’s a big opportunity for someone in our industry to implement a content marketing strategy that educates researchers how to do that. It will be your job to refine, implement and manage our content marketing strategy, and establish Trialfacts as the thought-leader within our industry. We’ve dipped our toe in the water, and although there’s huge room for improvement, the initial results from our content marketing have been very positive.
  • Market— A large part of this role will involve implementing and managing a wide array of strategies to market our educational content to researchers and potential clients. We’re looking for someone who is comfortable implementing and managing email marketing, search engine optimization, influencer outreach, social media promotion strategies, as well as anything else that makes sense. You’ll be expected to grow our weekly inbound enquiries, and held accountable to those results.
  • Learn— You’ll need to rapidly develop a thorough understanding of our industry, our clients, how they operate, their concerns, our service, and new software and technology. The marketing landscape is constantly evolving, so you’ll need to be able to stay up to date and independently learn via courses and other resources that we’ll pay for.
  • Lead—We’re looking for someone who will provide leadership in our client marketing. You won’t be able to do it all yourself, and so you’ll need to be comfortable hiring, assessing, managing and holding accountable the various marketing freelancers that are needed to get the job done. But you will also be expected to lead from the front; as a small company, our marketing budget is limited, so you’ll need to be very comfortable rolling up your sleeves and implementing our marketing strategies yourself.

What’s in it for you:

  • Autonomy— We don’t have set working hours. We don’t have a leave application process (you can take paid holidays whenever you want). We don’t micromanage or babysit. You’ll be accountable to the rest of the team purely on your results, and not on the number of hours spent working.
  • Our team is remote (we communicate via Slack, Basecamp and video conferencing software). We set our own hours based on what works for us and our clients. As long as you have a good internet connection you can work from wherever in the world you choose.
  • Opportunity— As a small and innovative team we’ve done away with outdated corporate thinking like the physical office, micromanaging and bureaucratic leave processes, but we haven’t thrown the baby out with the bathwater. We offer a stable salary + results-based compensation package, discretionary annual bonuses, annual salary review, a personal and tailored development plan, and the possibility to grow into positions of additional responsibility and leadership in the future.
  • We’re growing rapidly through repeat business, referrals and outbound marketing, and we’re looking to add inbound marketing to the mix. We’re an innovative company in an industry ripe for disruption. The future looks optimistic as we continue to improve and expand on our core service.
  • Innovation— We’ve launched innovative patient recruitment strategies (e.g. our phone screening appointment system, researcher interviews, social media recruitment), and we’re constantly improving our service. We have developed a data-driven forecasting approach that provides predictability in a volatile industry. Our consistent, data-driven process has allowed us to be the first and only recruitment company to provide certainty to our clients via a money-back guarantee.
  • It’s our data-driven approach and continuous focus on innovative patient recruitment strategies that we want to teach and share with other researchers through our content marketing.
  • Impact— Trialfacts plays an extremely important role in contributing to medical research and driving humanity forward. Our clients—researchers working at universities, pharmaceutical companies, biotech companies, natural medicine companies, hospitals and medical practices—work hard to develop treatments and technology that cure diseases and improve quality of life.
  • Growth— As a member of a small team you’ll be exposed to many areas of the business. You’ll be given the opportunity to learn many new skills and experiment in many new areas, as well as progress and build on what you already know. You’ll be testing and implementing new marketing strategies. You’ll have access to courses and training programs of your choice, paid for by Trialfacts. Each quarter we’ll put in place a Development Plan to increase your skills, knowledge, experience, and responsibility.

This position is for you if you:

  • Understand what makes people tick— you’ll need to rapidly develop an intimate understanding of the different client types we work with, along with their daily struggles, hopes and fears, what drives them, and what keeps them up at night. If you’re not comfortable speaking with our potential clients, asking probing questions and doing whatever it takes to develop this understanding, this is not the position for you.
  • Excel at written communication— we have a content writer that we work with, but you’ll be editor-in-chief for all our educational articles. You’ll also be responsible for other communication such as email marketing, and being a remote team, being able to write well is a must for any Trialfacts position.
  • Understand content marketing— we’ve dipped our toe in the water and have a good start, but now we’re looking for someone who has a deep understanding of content marketing, and can implement search engine optimization (white hat), email marketing (campaign and autoresponder), influencer outreach, social media promotion and other marketing strategies.
  • Are highly organized— you’ll be held accountable for delivering across a multitude of varied marketing projects, and need to hold accountable a multitude of freelancers to ensure each project is completed on time. If you’re not highly organized and comfortable in a fast-paced environment then you’re not a good-fit for this role.
  • Have a passion for making data-driven decisions— these days marketing requires a love of data. Our recruitment approach is a data-driven one, which is something we want reflected in our content marketing. If you’re not comfortable with gathering, cleaning and interpreting data, then please don’t apply. You don’t need to have a statistics PhD, but if you’re not handy around a spreadsheet, then this is not the position for you.
  • Are proficient in HTML & CSS— Similar to the above, marketing today relies heavily on technology and automation. You don’t need any formal development experience but if you’re not comfortable with at least HTML, please don’t apply. Similarly, if you’re not the kind of person that loves testing out new tools and technology, this position is not a good fit.
  • Are flexible— in an entrepreneurial business we sometimes have to wear different hats. We’re looking for someone that takes ownership and wants to help grow our company. If you’re the kind of person who would rather sit back and say “that’s not my responsibility” then please don’t apply.
  • Love learning— we’re a team that’s driven by learning and improving. We’re looking for someone who wants to learn and develop their professional and marketing skills, grow as a person and constantly improve the service that we provide.
  • Are results-driven— you will be coached and guided, but ultimately you will be responsible for your performance which will directly impact your compensation.
  • Are looking for a full-time position— we’re experiencing growth and we need someone who can fully commit to Trialfacts and get up to speed quickly. We’re not looking for someone who has their own part-time business or freelancing career on the side.

Summary

Yes, this position description is so long that it needs a summary! Here are the facts:

  • Set your own hours: Choose when and how you work, but there needs to be some flexibility to have training and meetings with our CEO Nick (located in Australia) and the rest of the team. This is a full-time position.
  • Work remotely: We’re a virtual team located around the globe. You can live anywhere or travel with this position. You will need a reliable internet connection.
  • Results-based environment: You’ll be evaluated based on your results. You will not be micromanaged, and you have the flexibility to set your own hours and work however you like, but you need to be contributing to our target number of new client conversations scheduled with our CEO Nick each week, and the number of new clients we welcome onboard each month.
  • Commitment to learning: We believe in continuous improvement and growth. You’ll be mentored, guided, and trained by our CEO Nick, our team and external resources, courses and training programs paid for by Trialfacts.
  • Contribute something meaningful to the world: We make a lot of medical research possible that would otherwise fail, and remove the #1 headache faced by researchers in a predictable and reliable manner, backed by our money-back guarantee.
  • Trial period: There will be an initial paid trial period typically lasting 2-3 weeks, but it’s possible it might be longer.
  • Compensation: Compensation will be a monthly salary plus performance-based compensation package. Salaries are reviewed annually.
Apply for job

items.title: Workforce Optimization Analyst
items.content:
Workforce Optimization Analyst at Travel Leaders Corporate

Remote

Job Locations: US-Work from Home

Job ID: 2018-1612

Division: Travel Leaders Corporate

# of Openings: 1

Category: Accounting/Finance

Overview

As America’s largest travel agency company, Travel Leaders Group (TLG) delivers a high-touch, personal level of travel expertise to leisure and corporate clients through its more than 7,000 company-owned, franchised and affiliated travel agencies and over 40,000 travel agents and 1,400 employees who service more than $20 billion of gross travel bookings annually. The travel agencies that are part of Travel Leaders Group comprise over 30% of all agencies in North America.

Travel Leaders Corporate is part of Travel Leaders Group, which ranks as the #1 business travel management company by Business Travel News and had sales approaching $21 billion in 2015. Travel Leaders Corporate’s consultative approach builds a travel program around clients’ specific needs, rather than requiring them to conform to standardized processes.

TLC has a current need for a Workforce Optimization Analyst to join our team.

The successful candidate will have strong analytics and organizational skills. The candidate will optimize existing workforce management tools and principles to provide assist in the support of current and future capacity demands for all operational contact center channels.

Responsibilities

Forecasting and Planning

  • Utilizing available technology and workforce management principle, the Work Force Optimization Analyst will offer assistance to the Manager related to the following tasks: shift bid process, weekly/monthly staff planning to ensure service levels are achieved.
  • Weekly planning session help gather pertinent information and reports prior to the weekly meeting, attend all meetings with the operations leadership, recap follow up items and help ensure completion.
  • Will analyze various reports to identify opportunities for business time off the phones. (Completion of coaching sessions, training, and other projects required of phone counselors).
  • Will support management team in efforts to secure overtime or communicate appropriate LWOP opportunities to the team in a timely manner.
  • Support Manager with annual vacation bid process

Real time call center management

  • Assist in daily exceptions processing
  • Assist in daily time off processing (new requests and cancellations)
    • Enter approved changes in outlook
    • Enter approved changes in Call Copy
  • Update the Attendance Tracker daily and support with distribution to the leadership team
  • Monitoring CMS
    • Create alert when service levels are within Rapid Action guidelines
    • Notify leadership team RAP is active
    • Adjust agent skills to support SLA in real time

Data Analysis and Reporting

  • Produce and distribute daily reporting on previous day telephone statistics (TSF).
  • Provide insight into trends/patterns including but not limited to: call arrival, forecast demand vs. actuals, and handle time.
  • Create and maintain agent matrix outlining all cross skilled/back up agents across the Travel Leaders Corporate team.

Qualifications

  • 3-5 years’ experience reporting and/or data analytics
  • Basic knowledge and understanding of scheduling principles.
  • Exposure to basic with workforce management tools and capabilities.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to partner with department leaders and share insights.
  • Ability to work in a virtual environment.
  • Ability to demonstrate results.
Apply for job
