items.content:
Product Manager

Marketing
Anywhere
Company: Mozilla
Full Time

Overview

Firefox Test Pilot’s mission is to research, build, and test experimental features and services that shape the future of the Firefox product ecosystem. Since forming two years ago, our team has produced several widely-used features in Firefox (Screenshots, Containers, Activity Stream), and we’ve recently expanded to mobile services (Firefox Send, Firefox Lockbox). Over the next few years, we will define, develop and mature a high-value product ecosystem that extends Mozilla’s mission beyond browsers and into new product lines.

We are looking for an experienced product leader to identify emerging product opportunities, drive the testing, development and deployment of prototype experiences, and articulate a vision for scaling these new products to extend our ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Define the vision, strategy, and business cases for early-stage products and services.
  • Facilitate and support lightweight product validation and research.
  • Articulate requirements for MVP testing.
  • Manage and prioritize a backlog of experimental concepts with input from Firefox leadership and community.
  • Drive new products from prototype-stage to large-scale launches.
  • Work with Test Pilot and UR and Design teams identify research to identify and prioritize targets for new product experimentation.
  • Work with Firefox Product and Engineering leadership to identify high-value integration points for new products.
  • Define product goals and build the dashboards to track them.

    • Preferred Qualifications:
    • Strong technical literacy: preferably comfort with Android and modern web-development practices (React/Redux/ES6/CI/GitHub &c.)
    • Working knowledge of user research methodologies and best practices.
    • Experience with lightweight concept validation and qualitative user research methodologies.
    • Experience with quantitative research tools such as MVT and A/B Testing.
    • Experience with surveying tools.

      • About Mozilla

      Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of Web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the Web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.

      We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Cincinnati, United States, Remote · Full Time

Job Description

Rocketship -- that is the word that was used to explain what it is like to join InfoTrust at this time. We have done all the prep, we have build this amazing architecture for success (the ship) not we are getting ready to launch? Are you ready to board?

We are currently looking for a DIGITAL ANALYTICS CONSULTANT who is an expert in analytics and digital marketing.

The Digital Analytics Consultant role will be responsible for client management, advanced implementations of Google Analytics, auditing and troubleshooting existing configurations, and reporting analysis to improve clients’ digital marketing initiatives.

You will work closely with web analytics engineer/architect to develop custom tagging and measurement systems.

Responsibilities:

- Identifying client objectives and mapping suitable analytics solutions, ensuring that all required performance data can be reliably tracked and reported
- Advanced Google Tag Manager architecture and setup of complex tracking scripts
- Producing analytics audit reports for corrective or advanced Google Analytics tracking and data collection architecture
- Performing ad-hoc analytics consultancies for clients and documenting the work
– Delivering analytics audit reports to clients and presenting findings in person or via conference calls
- Representing the InfoTrust team in client meetings and presentations, providing technical analytics input
- Assisting in educating clients on the importance of online measurement & providing best practice guidance for technical aspects of analytics
- Providing training to clients ranging from product training for marketing teams to implementation training for technical teams
- Providing consultancy on campaign tagging and providing consultancy on campaign tagging and additional on-site tracking
- Providing guidance to data analysts to produce marketing dashboards via Google Drive, Excel and various APIs

Requirements

We are looking for someone the possess our core values and is looking for a place to drive impact, provide superior client support with GA and is looking for learn and grow as an individual and share that knowledge to drive the company towards continued success. The Senior Consultant would be expected to have the following background to be successful:

- Experience working with clients in a consulting role
- Well versed in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager -- from developing client specific implementation plans, to overseeing the implementation and assisting them to identify key ways to improve their marketing initiatives based on the good clean data that InfoTrust will provide.
- Proven experience as a team player -- You enjoy working in a fun and collaborative culture and are willing to take initiative!

We are looking for someone in Cincinnati, Ohio. Ask why Cincinnati might be a great option to relocate to -- we are happy to brag about our city!

We would be willing to consider remote (experienced) workers, just let us know why you are great at working remotely.

Must be authorized to work for any US employer.

Senior Product Manager at ClickTime

Remote

Full-time

Allows Remote

About Us

We’re ClickTime. We help businesses become more productive every day. Our time and expense tracking tools are used by thousands of companies worldwide.

Our headquarters are in the heart of downtown San Francisco, with distributed teammates located in Austin, Denver, Atlanta, and beyond. As a bootstrapped, privately held, profitable entity, we provide big company benefits while maintaining the size and energy of a startup. Working with us means you’ll be challenged, surrounded by high-quality teammates, and learn something new every day.

About the Role

ClickTime is searching for a Senior Product Manager to join our quickly-growing team. Since we’re a small team, you’ll be hands-on in practically every dimension of creating product, from conceptualizing ideas to drafting mockups, talking to customers, listening to sales calls, and everything in-between. You love solving a customer’s problems with intuitive technology, and you’re excited to share that success with your colleagues every day.

Responsibilities

  • Define and prioritize the product roadmap for assigned product area(s), including mobile application
  • Define and deliver product requirements, user stories, technical product specifications, and prototypes
  • Lead a cross-functional team to build and develop the product
  • Perform competitive analysis to understand market positioning and opportunities
  • Define and analyze product metrics to inform decision-making and measure success
  • Understand and stay current on industry trends, competitive landscape and sector activity

Requirements

  • 3+ years experience in product management, preferably in a B2B environment
  • Strong sense of ownership and accountability toward everything you create
  • Entrepreneurial spirit. You know how to solve problems and take initiative at a small company
  • Consensus-builder. You develop relationships across the company with ease
  • Flexible; able to rapidly adjust priorities
  • Strong project management and analytical skills, with a tendency toward data-backed decisions
  • BA or BS required

Perks

Competitive salary, profit-sharing, medical/dental/vision, health savings account, subsidized transit, 401(k) with matching, very good coffee, chocolate. We’re a tight-knit group of about 35 with an energetic company culture.

What’s Next

Please submit your resume and cover letter explaining a little more about yourself and why ClickTime would be a good fit for you.

ClickTime is an equal opportunity employer (EEO), and we value diversity at our company. We provide employment opportunities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

items.content:
JOB TYPE: Part Time

EXPERIENCE: beginner

COMPANY: Invalley; 1-10 employees; 50-75% remote;

Invalley is offering an exciting job opportunity for a new campaign manager to join our super-talented and friendly team. The right candidate will have the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the world, with a fully flexible schedule and plenty of room for professional development.

If this sounds like something you’d be interested in, read on for all the details.

Who Are We and What Do We Do?

Let us start by introducing ourselves. We’re an SEO company based in Nijmegen, the Netherlands (the oldest city in our country) which provides innovative link-building campaigns for customers all across the world. For over 8 years, we’ve been helping all types of clients - from small digital agencies to large fortune 500 media companies - to improve their ranking in the SERPs through our website invalley.com.

What Will You Do?

As a campaign manager, you’ll be responsible for ensuring that our link-building campaigns are carried out perfectly. To do this, you’ll manage a team of high-quality link builders and content writers as they create and distribute the content. Once the campaign is complete, you’ll also send the final report to the client.

There are 5 key tasks that our campaign managers need to complete:

● Planning/Outsourcing: using our collaboration tool Monday.com, you will plan the campaign and ensure that the right content writers and link builders are assigned to the appropriate tasks.
● Team support: you’ll support a team of link builders and content writers, answer any questions they may have, and make sure deadlines are met.
● Quality check: you’ll check whether our team conducts every campaign task correctly.
● Report delivery: you’ll deliver the final report to the client. Most link-building campaigns are delivered within 2 to 4 weeks.
● Customer support: when a customer has questions or feedback, you are the first point of contact. If they require any revisions, you’ll communicate this back to the team.

Who is Our Ideal Candidate?

● You have strong communication skills. You’ll need this as you’re the point of contact for both our customers and our team. You’re someone who enjoys communicating with your social contacts on a daily basis. As you’ll be emailing often, having English as your first language is preferred.
● You have a basic level of knowledge of the fundamentals of SEO. Do you know the difference between different types of anchor texts? And can you talk about off-site optimisation or Domain Authority? If so, we’d love to talk further with you.
● You’re a planning expert. You’re always on top of your schedule and you love to finish tasks on-time. You don’t just have a good overview of your own agenda, you can also keep an overview of a team of people.
● You’re a perfectionist. At Invalley.com, we’re known for our attention to detail - this can be seen in everything we do. You’re the type of person that notices when a piece of content uses 3 different types of fonts or doesn’t contain any capital letters and changes it.
● You’re familiar with using applications like Google Drive, Gmail, Google Sheets and Google Docs. You have good technical skills and can quickly adapt to new tools such as Monday.com.
● You are a trustworthy, assertive and responsible person with a strong work ethic and a passion for great customer service.

What Do We Offer?

● An awesome opportunity to work from anywhere in the world!
● A fully flexible schedule - you can work whenever you choose to.
● A position in which you have high responsibilities and plenty of opportunities for professional growth.
● On-the-job training. We will first teach you how to handle the Quality Checks and Report Delivery tasks, which will take approximately 10 hours per week.
● If all goes well, you’ll start working on all 5 management tasks and gradually transition into a full-time role (40 hours per week).
● Weekly payments through PayPal

items.title: Fusionetics: Senior Product Analyst
items.content:
Senior Product Analyst

Company: Fusionetics
Headquarters: Atlanta, GA
https://fusionetics.com


Who We Are

At Fusionetics we are moving the needle on the health of millions of people. From elite athletes to people who sit in front of computers all day our solutions help reduce pain, improve performance, and speed up injury recovery.

We are a ROWE, remote-assumed product team that has built and supports web and mobile applications used by people throughout the world. A partial client list: https://fusionetics.com/

What We Need

Basecamp has this idea of the hill chart that elegantly captures building digital products. We need someone to help us get things over the top of the hill for our software feature changes. This role will begin by supporting us in the front-end gathering and defining requirements, and on the backend testing that these specs were met.

This means that you will work in two phases:

Definition: help us define, document, and dial-in what needs to be built, and how. For this phase, you will work with our product manager, designers, and developers to figure out what the solution should be, and how it surfaces to the user.

Quality: help us to test the software after it comes out of development, providing feature set and UX feedback to stakeholders.

Who You Are

You can own software definition and quality. You don't mind getting your hands dirty testing a complex and changing domain including a website, API Suite, and multiple mobile applications.

You are comfortable with autonomy, and the harsh light of direct no-excuses accountability that comes with it.

Also:

- The desire to deliver high-quality products and services.

- Experience in the development and production process of mobile and web applications.

- Highly organized and can write clearly; specs, bug reports, etc.

- Can multi-task while working on several projects simultaneously.

- Strong, bordering on aggressive, communication skills.

Extra Credit

- Leadership experience

- Have worked with a distributed company before

- Previous work in the healthcare space

Expectations

Apply by sending an email to productJobs@fusionetics.com

After you apply, we will have you fill out some quick online Q+A, talk to us over video chat, and then talk to a larger group. We won’t have you try to take a test on some online whiteboard as we criticize you, but will expect you to come prepared.

As part of the overall hiring process you will:

-    Talk to the person you will report to and the team you will work with.

-    Find out more information about our company goals, culture, and processes.

-    Be provided a more detailed job description and explanation of the role and expectations. You will see a week’s worth of real tasks this job would have performed and a list of planned projects waiting on this role.

Apply for this position

Email productJobs@fusionetics.com

GM India - Product, Sales, Marketing, & Evangelism at Crowdera

India, Mumbai, Nagpur, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Business Development, Corporate Development, Product Marketing, Non-Profit Experience, Customer Development, Social Media Marketing, Press Outreach, Social Entrepreneurship, Sales and Marketing, Executive Leadership, Crowdfunding, Social Media Strategy, Corporate Social Responsibility, Corporate and Marketing Strategy, Non-Profit Fundraising, Press and Corporate Communications, Nonprofit Management, Philanthropy, Celebrity/Influencer Outreach, Employee Engagement and CSR activities

Job Description

As GM India, you will report directly to the founder and will be part of core management team. Your sole purpose is to set-up a strong presence of Crowdera in India by evangelizing, and to progress the vision of the company through action on the ground. You have to a self-starter, build the Indian operations ground up, evangelize & scale Crowdera's brand among all business associates and partners – philanthropists, social entrepreneurs, high net worth donors & investors, corporates, celebrities or government officials.

In this demanding and multidimensional role, you will serve as a trusted aide to the founder on planning and execution of all matters pertaining to Crowdera’s India operations.

Success in this role will be defined by your ability to think both strategically and tactically, exercise good judgment, build and manage excellent relations with clients, lead team and numerous assignments with perfection in a fast-paced and creative environment.

Responsibilities
- Evangelize Crowdera vision and mission within India.
- Spearhead the customer development & customer fundraising success.
- Build partnerships with large corporations, public sector, third sector, foundations, celebrity circuit, and HNIs in APAC.
- Lead sales and corporate development in corporate giving space and fundraising space.
- Keep track of new legislative developments on CSR and trends in Corporate Giving.
- Build & manage India team. Be responsible for all HR functions and beyond– morale, motivation, performance, hiring, retention, termination.

items.title: Digital Writer
items.content:
Digital Writer at Vitamin T

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

The Digital Writer will work closely with the Senior Digital Writer to provide writing support on simple and complex digital marketing communication materials. He or she will also collaborate with Digital Video Producers, Web UI Developers, and UX Designers, depending on the project. The Digital Writer supports the Marcom Creative Digital Team by providing web copy (landing pages, microsites), emails, video storyboards, and scripting.

  • Primary duties to include but are not limited to strong writing skills, with the ability to write for various audiences and digital formats.
  • This position can work remotely.

Requirements:

  • Requires a BA/BS degree; 5 years of writing experience, with exposure to digital formats; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
  • Prior experience writing in the healthcare sector preferred.
  • Strong writing skills, with the ability to write for various audiences and digital formats.
  • Familiarity with web writing best practices, including metadata, tagging, and SEO.
  • Ensures all materials meet internal and external business and legal standards and follows appropriate corporate standards, guidelines and approval processes. Ability to learn quickly and adapt to a fast-paced environment.
  • Proven self-starter and ability to balance multiple priorities.
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Dependent on our capacity levels from our internal requestor stakeholders. 2-4 hours a week, Monday through Friday. Open Enrollment peak season could be 30-40 hours a week, Monday through Friday.**

Client Description:

As a Fortune 50 company, our client has been the recipient of numerous awards and accolades, including being distinguished as one of Working Mother magazine’s “100 Best Places to Work” and one of Fortune magazine’s “America’s Most Admired Companies” among health insurers. Our client is also a 2017 Diversity Inc. magazine Top 50 Company for Diversity.

When joining a team at our client, you have the exceptional opportunity to do innovative work where every person counts and all perspectives matter.

What we have heard from talent who work there and why they love it:

  • Opportunities to work with innovative digital solutions and initiatives
  • A strong focus on diversity and inclusion in the workplace
  • A strong probability for temp-to-perm conversion (1 in 3 of our talent convert!)

items.title: Technical Product Manager at Citrusbyte (Los Angeles, CA)
items.content:
Technical Product Manager

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Product Manager
Company: Citrusbyte | Los Angeles, CA

Remote details

Office Location: Los Angeles, CA. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

product
tpm

Job description

Company Overview

Citrusbyte is a team of craftspeople and experts who build amazing products and believe in cultivating a high degree of leadership in all of our people. We build medium and large-scale applications that solve our customers' business-critical problems.

Job Summary

We're looking for an experienced product manager to join the team at Citrusbyte. It is expected that you have lived the full product lifecycle, having brought multiple products to market.

In this role, you will lead a team of  10-14 engineers operating in small squads of 2-3 engineers and work directly with a research and design team and customer technical leads to build complex custom software applications.

Responsibilities and Duties

As a product manager supporting the technical development of a product, you are responsible for communicating the overall product guidance, vision, and prioritization, planning, and stakeholder communication. As the voice of the product, you will help the engineers organize incremental releases that achieve the product's short-term goals and align with the product's long-term vision.  You've got to be a quick study and become a domain expert in the areas required for your products: You need to know the business opportunities, competitors, customer pain points and technical details about each product. The Product Manager is also a guide. Clients and engineerings will look to you to chart out the approach that will deliver business-driven results within a committed time and budget.

You will work closely with our designers who actually do the design & wireframing but you should be able to roll up your sleeves to create and make changes to wireframes yourself.

  • Strategy: Collecting research, running project kickoffs, and defining business goals 
  • Consulting: Guiding client stakeholders and program management teams through the right steps to build  a world-class product that meets the product's business goals
  • Design: Coordinate directly with UX/UI designers and engineering leads to ensure technical feasibility of proposed designs and refine user stories for engineers to execute the build
  • Engineering: Overseeing the delivery of each project milestone by managing/collaborating with the project team

We are looking for smart, driven & talented people who want to work in a consultative environment, help our clients have great projects and also contribute to the growth of a great company. Tell us more about you!

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% REMOTE
  • TEAM RETREAT - Once a year the entire Citrusbyte team gest together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play.
  • HEALTHY BODY, HEALTHY MIND - HAPPY TEAM - We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program.
  • HEALTHCARE & FINANCE - We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan.

Citrusbyte expects employees to be honest, trustworthy, and operate with integrity. Discrimination and all unlawful harassment (including sexual harassment) in employment is not tolerated. We encourage success based on our individual merits and abilities, and all decisions regarding recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, employee development decisions such as training, and all other terms and conditions of employment, will be made without regard to race, nationality, national origin, citizenship status, employment status, ethnicity, ethnic origin, color, creed, religion, belief, age, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender identity, sexual preference, lifestyle, social class, military status, disability, physical features, or any other protected status. We oppose all forms of unlawful or unfair discrimination. Citrusbyte is an equal opportunity employer.

No statements by Citrusbyte are intended to create an offer of employment unless made in a writing signed by an officer of the company and no offer shall become effective unless countersigned by the prospective employee.

Apply now

About Citrusbyte

Citrusbyte is a team of craftspeople and experts who build amazing products and believe in cultivating a high degree of leadership in all of our people. We build medium and large scale applications that solve our customers' business-critical problems.

items.content:
Cotiviti Labs Golang Innovator

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Industry: Healthcare, Retail Analytics
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Public
Company: Cotiviti | Atlanta, GA

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 10 hours
Office Location: Atlanta, GA. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

aws-lambda
amazon-web-services
scala
go
python-3.x

Job description

Developers with the Cotiviti Labs team are responsible for working with a global team of medical doctors and business experts to create break-through solutions for incredibly difficult problems. We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies for game-changing solutions. In 2017, we found $3.2B in savings for our clients in 2017 to spend on better health care for their members. 

We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies to put game-changing solutions into production as quickly as possible. Our solutions are scalable, elastic, concurrent, parallel, and deliver results to our clients in real-time.  We are a functional programming shop but are willing to use the best technologies to get into production quickly.  Our DevOps team members have created a sophisticated ChatOps infrastructure that supports everything from deployments, to releases, to provisioning new clients. Our continuous integration and build facilities are world class.

Take our online coding test to get the process started!

REQUIREMENTS:

  • A burning desire to see your work in production
  • A passion for and experience with Golang
  • A passion for and experience with concurrent and parallel development
  • A deep understanding of Reactive Architectures
  • Desire and passion to learn new concepts and software
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving ability
  • Strong mathematical skills
  • Professional with the ability to properly handle confidential information
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment
  • We are a diverse, multi-cultural global team so you must have excellent written and verbal English skills. Fluency in Hindi, Russian, or Telegu is a plus.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3+ years’ experience in advanced development environments delivering production solutions
  • Degree in computer science (Masters degree is a plus)
  • 95% or higher on our online Golang coding test.
  • Creativity and critical thinking
  • Ability to work independently as well as collaborate as a team

JOB DEMANDS:

  • Must be able to sit and use a computer keyboard for extended periods of time
  • After hours/weekend work required where necessary for major deliverables/deadlines (not consistent)
  • Must have flexibility and willingness to participate in the work processes of an international organization, including conference calls scheduled to accommodate global time zones.
  • Mastery of Cards Against Humanity

KEY CONSTITUENTS:

  • VP of Innovation
  • Chief Operations Officer
  • Chief Digital Officer
Apply now

About Cotiviti

The Cotiviti Labs team is the advanced research and development arm of Cotiviti Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: COTV), a leading provider of analytics-driven payment accuracy solutions primarily focused on the healthcare industry. We work with data from billions of health care interactions that occur every day between doctors and patients and convert that data into a rich web of relationships that we then mine for patterns. Each pattern is translated into a solution that helps our clients achieve a superior level of payment accuracy. Joining our team will provide you with a rewarding opportunity to influence healthcare efficiency and effectiveness by discovering and deploying new Cotiviti solutions.

The Cotiviti Labs team has a flat organizational structure so people on this team have no direct managers, are responsible for their own work assignments, and will receive and give quarterly 360 reviews from their peers. We have no deadlines, only a requirement to move as fast as humanly possible and make every minute count. To thrive in this environment team member must have a passion for computer science, technology, innovation, and delivery.

We value teamwork above everything. We succeed together as a team and are accountable to each other for that success. Though we are scattered across the world we regularly get together to have fun. If you are looking for such a tribe apply now.

Learn more about our team by reading our handbook!

Benefits

  • Close to the Marta!
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Remote work available
  • Have a big impact on healthcare
  • Work with an amazing team
  • Use powerful technologies
  • Tuition Reimbersement
  • Flexible work schedule

Developer - Productivity

About this job

Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: DevOps
Industry: Education Technology, eLearning, Non-Profit

Company: Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. | No office location

Technologies

devops
kubernetes
system

Job description

Location: San Francisco, CA or Remote

Come join the Wikimedia Foundation’s Technology department. You’ll be join the team that provides the development, testing, and deployment experience for all of our internal staff and external volunteer engineers. We care about the intersection of the developer experience and site reliability. Our team works remotely and so can you!

You will be leading the effort to improve overall developer productivity. We will want you to create a replacement for our homebuilt Vagrant-based local development environment using the latest technologies such as Kubernetes (minikube), Docker, and Helm. You will be working closely with several teams and volunteers in the community.

Responsibilities

  • Help engineer container based tooling for MediaWiki application development and deployment
  • Maintain integration of developer tooling into a continuous delivery pipeline
  • Proactively find and create productivity improvements
  • Working in a highly collaborative and open organization and community

Requirements

  • Proficiency with software, systems, or devops engineering
  • Collaboration skills are as, if not more, important as technical skills
  • Experience with continuous integration/deployment systems
  • Experience with virtualization or container technologies
  • Experience with server configuration management software

Nice to haves

  • Free Software experience
  • Experience working in a remote-first organization
  • Experience using a Kubernetes environment
  • MediaWiki and/or Wikimedia project experience
  • Golang experience

The Wikimedia Foundation is... 

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply

Benefits & Perks *

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

* for benefits eligible staff, benefits may vary by location

We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. items.content:
Information Security Analyst

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Education Technology, eLearning, Non-Profit
Company size: 201-500 people
Company: Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. | San Francisco, CA

Remote details

Office Location: San Francisco, CA. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

security
threat-model

Job description

Summary

We are looking for a smart security practitioner with an interest in large scale systems. You understand the importance of testing and documentation, and common pitfalls in developing secure web applications. You must have a passion for the WMF mission. We do (almost) everything publicly, and volunteers can add arbitrary JavaScript to our site. That should both frighten and thrill you.

Privacy is one of the core values of the Wikimedia Foundation and you will be joining the team responsible for providing technical and governance security solutions to ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of Wikimedia applications.  This is your opportunity to participate in and provide security and privacy solutions so together we can create a world in which everyone can freely share in the sum of all knowledge.  

This is what you will be doing:

  • Review security controls, policies and procedures and provide recommendations for the adaption of new technologies or policies.  
  • Conduct internal and external security audits
  • Provide support for security incidents or events
  • Evaluate current organizational risk and threat profile
  • Identify improvement areas and provide organization wide security awareness training.  
  • Work with teams to ensure they make safe, compliant, design and architectural decisions
  • Participate in privacy initiatives
  • Participate in operational security initiatives

You’ll need these skills and experience:

  • 5+ years experience as part of an Information Security team
  • CISSP/GIAC
  • Experience in policy creation and enforcement
  • Experience with Threat Modeling and Risk Assessments
  • Experience in Incident Response
  • Bachelor’s degree in CS or related field or the equivalent in work related experience

Pluses

  • Wikimedia community experience
  • Interest in/passion for all things open source

The Wikimedia Foundation is... 

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply

Benefits & Perks *

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

* for benefits eligible staff, benefits may vary by location

More information

WMF

Blog

Annual Report - 2017

Wikimedia 2030



Apply now

About Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.

The Wikimedia Foundation is...

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

Benefits

  • Fully paid premiums for medical, dental & vision insurance premiums
  • 401(k) with 4% matching contribution
  • 7-12 weeks parental leave with 100% pay + lactation room
  • Wellness Program ($1800 annual) to promote wellness & personal growth
  • Pre-tax savings plans for Transportation & Parking
  • Flexible work schedules and remote working options
  • Pet Friendly office
  • Commitment to diversity & inclusion throughout the employee lifecycle
  • 12 days vacation, 19 days holiday, 2 days volunteer work and more!
  • Lean more at https://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Work_with_us

items.content:
Search Wrangler

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Internet of Things
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: Private
Company: Automattic | No office location

Technologies

elasticsearch
php
mysql
apache-spark
apache-kafka

Job description

Automattic builds related content, recommendations, and search for websites, e-commerce sites, blogs, and the WordPress.com Reader. We connect millions of publishers with billions of readers every month and look for ways to help new publishers build an audience. We have only just started to scratch the surface of providing engaging, relevant search results for the Open Web.

Our system runs on open source: Elasticsearch, MySQL, Spark, Kafka, HDFS (and tied together by WordPress of course).

Sound fun? It is.

Here are some things we’re looking for:

  • Desire to build and refine great search experiences that tie together the pieces from across our software stack.
  • Experience with Open Source search systems: Elasticsearch, Solr, Lucene.
  • Great programming skills in both dynamic and compiled languages (especially PHP and Java/Scala).
  • Knowledge of scaling search systems: high volume indexing and querying.
  • Understanding how to combine and build signals from many sources to craft and evaluate novel search algorithms.
  • Ability to take a project from idea to implementation, putting the minimal system needed into production, but with an eye on where we need to be in 5 years.
  • A deep understanding of distributed computing and system performance.
  • Troubleshooting skills.

We’re serious about growing diversity in the tech industry. We want to build Automattic as an environment where people love their work and show respect and empathy to those with whom we interact. Diversity typically includes, but is not limited to, differences in race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, political and religious affiliation, socioeconomic background, cultural background, geographic location, disabilities and abilities, relationship status, veteran status, and age. To work on diversity means that we welcome these differences, and strive to increase the visibility of traditionally underrepresented groups. Read more about our dedication to diversity and inclusion.

HOW TO APPLY

If you’re reading this on a site other than automattic.com please ensure you visit automattic.com/work-with-us for the latest details on applying.

Apply now

About Automattic

Automattic is the company behind WordPress.com, WordPress.com VIP, Akismet, Intense Debate, Gravatar, Polldaddy, Simplenote, and more. We're focused on making the web a better place.

We're also a 100% distributed company: everyone works from their own home or office, and we’re spread out all over the world — California, Texas, New York, Canada, Ireland, Japan, Iceland, Bulgaria, Australia, and more. We track about 70% of our projects on P2-themed WordPress.com blogs, and 30% on public and private Slack channels—no email! Because of the geographic variance, we’re active pretty much 24/7. We care about the work you produce, not just the hours you put in.

You can learn more about how we work, benefits, our development process, and more at http://automattic.com/work-with-us

Benefits

  • Open vacation policy (no set number of days per year).
  • Home office setup and co-working allowances.
  • Paid two to three-month sabbatical encouraged every five years.
  • Country specific health benefits
  • Open parental leave (includes maternity, paternity, and adoption).
  • WordPress-branded laptop at your four-year anniversary.

items.title: Marketing VA for NYC based Digital Marketing Firm
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Long Term
3+ months

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

Looking for a dynamic person with at least two years experience working as a virtual assistant who is interested in working from home, approximately 10-20 hours per month. This will be a good fit for you if you are already doing other virtual work and you're looking for immediate steady work as well as additional "on call" work as needs arise.

The role as Virtual Assistant is to support the President in her day-to-day activities.

We are a digital marketing agency that specializes in empowering small and growing businesses by creating digital marketing campaigns including Web sites, social media, email marketing, SEO and online advertising. Our President, has written extensively for Inc. magazine and has spoken at hundreds of events around the country and partnered with companies like Microsoft, JP Morgan Chase and Columbia University to help deliver small business content. We've worked with clients as big as Mars chocolate and as small as a 1-person clothing retailer and everything in-between.

This opportunity is ideal for someone who has experience working virtually, has experience with marketing, and expense reports, has EXCELLENT communications skills (perfect written and spoken grammar and a great "bedside manner"), has experience with virtual teams and is able to proactively help the President.

The Virtual Assistant is an appreciated player of the team who supports us in delivering results to our clients.

Responsibilities:
- track expenses and create expense reports
- transcribe contact lists from events
- liaise with other virtual team members
- manage speaking engagements and inquiries
- address team members' administrative queries
- assist with marketing tasks

Requirments:
- have at least 2 years experience working as a Virtual Assistant
- be solidly independent - you own your time and your work product
- enjoy working from home (or from the beach!)
- be a people person - people like and respect you and consider you fair
- be good at resolving issues, problems, mistakes and differences diplomatically and positively
- be an *extremely* proactive communicator (this one is important, extroverts encouraged to apply)
- be *extremely* detailed (obsessive ok :o) and have a lot of pride in your work
- be extremely responsible, responsive and efficient
- make deadlines (this is critical)
- own a private computer with broadband Internet access - shared computers not feasible
- be online and easily reached by phone from 9am-5pm ET (flexible)
- have experience working virtually

If interested please apply below:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdDJ80qF7Q8Q4yGs_B8d2T6_0so6s_C2J9Ap3LRlGw-G3sF_A/viewform?usp=sf_link

Please *do not* include your contact information with the pasted copy of your resume if you are applying via a freelancer Web site so we can abide by the site's Terms of Service. We will communicate with candidates exclusively via that site where applicable. PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION VIA THE ONLINE SITE AND VIA THIS QUESTIONNAIRE

items.content:
Digital Marketing Manager at Fast Growing, Award Winning, Sustainable and Ethical Brand

Is this you?
We are looking for a digital marketing manager to take the reins of all things digital marketing and brand at our company Supreme Creations and label Bags of EthicsTM. This could not be a more exciting time to join, and help drive growth for us, given the topical issues of sustainability, single-use plastic, and ethical manufacture.
This incredible opportunity is designed for someone who has at least 4+ years of core marketing experience in digital, is highly analytical, has a creative eye, brand management experience, strong skills in project management, and a global outlook. Belief in our mission is critical to our joint success.

Who we are
We are the world’s largest ethical manufacturer of reusable bags, and sustainable promotional textiles – everything from branded tote bags, to eco-packaging for luxury goods, to printed home textiles. For over 20 years Supreme Creations has been supplying some of the world’s best brands including Nike, Topshop, London Fashion Week and Tesco. Our headquarters are in London, and manufacturing base in South India – we own the entire supply chain. Our Bags of Ethics label represents our ethical and environmental efforts – 9 out of 10 of our workforce in India are women, many of whom are the main breadwinners in their families. Our philosophy is “Don’t Be Boring” – be creative, care for others, and don’t forget the environment.

Your responsibilities
• Help create and execute the company’s digital marketing strategy while identifying marginal gains and growth hacking opportunities in all our markets
• Produce high quality content for our websites, database, and social media platforms including blogs, newsletters, whitepapers, videos, images
• Project manage and coordinate between a remote team of 2- 4 marketing assistants, as well as freelancers (photographers, videographers, graphic designers) for daily, weekly, monthly campaigns
• Create and execute email marketing strategies for all our markets (UK + international) that drives conversion, customer retention, and loyalty to grow the business
• Manage, analyse and track our efforts on our websites (Google Analytics + other reporting tools) whilst working with our development team to improve user conversions
• Assist in delivering budget optimisations for our paid advertising (PPC on Google and social channels)
• Have a strong understanding of Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) and Conversion Rate Optimisation (CRO) via best practices across all web assets, and execute ways to improve organic ranking
• Planning, originating, co-ordinating, and optimising our B2B marketing activity across social media, and other channels – in particular Instagram, LinkedIN, Facebook, Pinterest, and Youtube with the aim of generating high quality leads for the sales team
• Coordinate creative campaigns (in-house) or on shoots (outside) –working with models, products, and brand ambassadors
• Create low cost brand partnerships with clients and influencers
• Produce high quality reports which are backed by both qualitative and quantitative analysis
• Work with focus groups/ customers/ sales team to improve our communication strategies, product or service
• Understand and keep a track of the latest trends
o Digital trends – latest tools for optimising campaigns, social media listening tools, website optimisation tools
o Design/ fashion/ product trends relevant for the fashion/ print/ packaging/ sustainability industry
o Market and macro trends competitor intelligence, customer trends, and market opportunities

About you
A Quick & Strategic Thinker. Digitally driven. Proactive self-starter. Ambitious. Not a 9-5er. Agile. Focussed. Creative. Care for People & Our Planet.

• Ability to project manage multiple projects, with different people (including freelance/ remote)
• Proven track record in increasing engagement and leads which will generate improved sales
• Proven track record in optimising budgets (digital marketing spends in particular)
• Excellent communication skills, including strong copywriting, editing, and visual skills
• Experience demonstrated with SEO, email marketing, social media, and digital advertising
• Design driven – you love images, creative, and video campaigns (previous experience within a design focussed industry is helpful)
• Back the mission to produce products which are good for the planet, highly reusable, and are beautifully designed
• Have a background in B2B marketing (or understand the marketing distinction between B2B and B2C)
• Commercially astute


Why join us?
• Competitive salary depending on experience
• Opportunity for you to grow the business and grow yourself
• Join an incredible team: our team are international, young at heart, and very positive
• Opportunity to work with our team in India
• Opportunity to work and mentor students with our partner charity Wings of Hope
• Free lunch on Wednesdays
• Very low hierarchy – you will be working with senior management frequently

How and when
Role is office based at our offices in Neasden, North West London (Jubilee Line).
Start date: ASAP
Any questions? Email us at hr@supreme-london.com
We sadly cannot answer questions on the phone.
Please send your CV and cover letter (and portfolio if you have one)

Job Description

Be part of the team that is driving change in the way people book and travel through ground transportation. We need someone who can help us increase our supply by approaching companies that run taxi, shuttle, limo express train and public transit organizations to expand our coverage and services. What we are looking for in our team mate:
1) Team Player
2) Someone who is driven by the passion to make a startup flourish
3) Proactive
4) Resourceful
5) Someone who stays positive in high stress or adversity.

Successful candidates will have experience in sales, customer relations, or any client facing role where they have had to convince customers to work with them.

In exchange for their long hours and hard work, Mozio's supplier relations team members earn competitive salaries, equity, the ability to work remotely from anywhere, and a flexible vacation policy. Mozio offers great leadership opportunities and flexibility to individuals who demonstrate an ability to get things done. Combine that with a "flat" organizational culture and lack of bureaucracy, and what's not to love!

Salary and equity are flexible and based on experience, location and other factors.

items.content:
Digital Marketing Assistant at Vortala

Remote
  • Family-Friendly Hours & Work from Home
  • Fast-Growing Digital Marketing Leader
  • Healthcare Focus…Helping Doctors Succeed

In 2004, Steve Anson and Bill Esteb founded Vortala with a simple vision to help doctors grow their practice using the Internet.

Today, our dedicated team of 70 marketing professionals serve thousands of healthcare practices worldwide. Busy doctors trust Vortala to manage their practice website and lead their digital strategy.

Our core values are Trust, Service and Innovation. Our team culture is based on practicing an Outward Mindset which is the simple idea that, “our success is a by-product of helping others succeed.”

Is our culture a good fit with your work and life philosophy?

Our brands include, Perfect Patients (allied healthcare), Smile Marketing (dental) and we’re expanding into other healthcare verticals.

ABOUT THE ROLE

As a Digital Marketing Assistant, your mission is to help our clients get and keep more new patients! The focus of your role is working closely with Digital Marketing Specialists to provide support on client management and delivery of our services to achieve exceptional new patient results. You’ll liaise with expert internal departments including SEO, PPC, graphic design, web development and copywriting.

To keep pace with the ever-changing digital landscape, you’ll be provided with ongoing training and development opportunities.

Reporting to the Manager, Smile Marketing, you’ll work with our specialist dental and medical brands, Smile Marketing and Vortala Digital and help manage an established portfolio of practice clients.

Your specific role responsibilities include:

  • Support project management of new client websites
  • Managing website edits/updates while following best practices of a high converting website. These include, but are not limited to, creating new pages, updating existing pages, changing images (including videos), resizing and optimizing, updating databases, making changes to site utility bars, theme options and creating slideshows
  • Working closely with Digital Marketing Specialists on various administrative and technical tasks. These include, but are not limited to, organizing patient subscriber lists and uploading to the databases, setting up client email accounts and updating client contact records
  • Managing initial Quality Assurance checks for the new site launches (training will be provided)
  • Monitor website performance and other key performance metrics
  • Other duties as required to support Digital Marketing Specialists to insure a successful, long term client relationship

HOW TO SECURE AN INTERVIEW

To be invited for an interview, you should possess the following skills and experience:

  • Excellent command of English and outstanding communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Advanced skills with Content Management Systems (e.g. WordPress or similar)
  • Working knowledge of HTML and CSS
  • Strong knowledge and experience with:
    • Google Analytics
    • SEO and its best practices
    • Google AdWords PPC & Social Media Management
  • Power-user with productivity tools including email, web search, CRMs and collaboration apps (e.g. Slack)
  • Excellent organizational skills to effectively prioritize tasks and initiatives
  • Experience working with Western clients is highly desirable

Experience in the health profession and working with doctors is desirable but not essential.

Our mantra is, “the company can only grow as fast as its people.”

This means we’re committed to your ongoing personal and professional development including weekly individual and team development activities and attending the company’s annual retreat in North America.

This is a full-time position with flexible, family-friendly hours.

You’ll work from the comfort of your home office and connect with your colleagues worldwide using the most advanced online collaboration tools.

Vortala is a fast-growing, equal opportunity employer riding the healthcare and technology wave.

Apply for job

items.title: Impala: Technical Product Manager
items.content:
Technical Product Manager

Company: Impala
Headquarters: London, GB
https://impala.breezy.hr/p/cbcde4a215d3-technical-product-manager?source=weworkremotely
Impala is looking for an experienced Technical Product Manager to join our completely remote team. You’ll be joining a rapidly expanding and well funded team that is solving huge data problems, starting with hotel technology.

What Is Impala?

At Impala, our mission is to make it incredibly easy for great entrepreneurs and developers to build travel applications. For decades, building anything connected to hotels has involved exceptionally cumbersome integrations. Impala's modern API makes the process of reading and writing hotel data much easier.

What You'll Be Doing
The Technical Product Manager at Impala will be responsible for ensuring the continuous delivery of our vision for a seamless hotel data platform. Responsibilities will include:

  • Owning, prioritising and developing our roadmap in terms of product features as well as integrations.
  • Acting as the initial technical voice of Impala in communications with potential partners and clients.
  • Ensuring a clear, understandable flow of information into and out of our engineering team.
  • Scoping and planning new products.
  • Leading customer development to ensure that our products are delivering value for the customers we serve.

Requirements
  • A first class intellect. A 1st class degree, a 2:1 from an exceptional institution or being Slovakia’s best chess player would all work.
  • Minimum 2 years experience in a Product Management role.
  • Understanding of APIs and experience with API design.

Nice-To-Haves
  • Experience working with hospitality software (PMS, CRS etc).
  • A background as a software engineer or in Computer Science.
  • Experience working remotely.

What We Do For You
Because we’re a fully remote company, Impalans work from wherever they are (so long as they’re within Western Europe). We provide a stipend which ensures that either you have a fully equipped home office or an office in a local co-working space that works for you.

  • Very competitive salary (£40 - 65k DOE)
  • You’ll get a hardware budget for buying your own equipment.
  • You’ll receive a monthly stipend for a home office or co-working space.
  • We offer generous holiday.
  • You’ll be a part of a company that puts professional development squarely front and centre.
  • You’ll attend frequent team meetings and gatherings across Europe including two, full week retreats per year (previously in the UK & Germany).

For more information on Impala, check out our blog:

What the Hell is Impala Anyway?
Culture At Impala

Apply for this position

https://impala.breezy.hr/p/cbcde4a215d3-technical-product-manager?source=weworkremotely

items.content:
PR & Communications Coordinator

Company: Wired Rhino
Headquarters: Newark, Delaware
We’re looking for a PR/communications professional to help us launch and grow a new site focused on small businesses.

In a nutshell, you will be the point man/woman, responding to press inquiries, performing outreach to potential media outlets and websites, and working with the rest of our remote team to get our content placed and in front of the right people.

While this job is remote (anywhere in the world), you will need to be available Monday-Friday overlapping with both Pacific and Eastern time, so you can do interviews.

Ideally, you have a PR, communications, and marketing background, and have worked on similar projects in the past, and can show us proven and successful campaigns that you’ve worked on recently.

What you’ll be doing day to day:

  1. Coordinating interview requests and doing the actual interviews (usually for local radio)

  2. Finding new outlets and doing outreach to get placed in those outlets

  3. Working with existing outlets you developed in #2 to get even more placements

  4. Reviewing inbound PR queries from various sources and responding to the relevant ones

  5. Managing the entire flow of research, outreach, placements, and interviews.

  6. Develop new tactics and strategies related to our PR

  7. Coming up with ideas for more PR content and then coordinating with our content team to get it built/executed

What success looks like:

(actual #s to be discussed with individual candidates)

  1. Increase in placements and articles about our content and message

  2. Web traffic on a consistent “up and to the right” basis

  3. Establishment of the brand as a go-to resource for journalists and reporters who report about issues related to small business and the economy

What we’re looking for in a hire:

  1. Have done something like this before.

  2. Have previous and good experience working remote.

  3. Are a detail-oriented person.

  4. Enjoy talking to and interacting with people.

  5. Speak and write fluent, mother-tongue English

  6. Know how to use tools like BuzzStream, BuzzSumo, aHrefs and the like to find PR and placement opportunities.

This position is on a Freelance/1099 basis.

Apply for this position

Please fill out this form: https://goo.gl/forms/anX4DR3Qk70kbant2

items.content:
Marketing/Growth Hacker at Knack

Earth, United States, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Analytics & Reporting, Product Marketing, SaaS, Conversion Optimization, A/B Testing, Landing Page Optimization, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Funnel Optimization
Compensation
$85K–$110K
0.5%–2.5%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

We’re looking for a marketing and growth hacker to help drive Knack's efforts in identifying markets and executing growth initiatives.

We've been managing growth but now it's time to start accelerating!

This position will straddle the traditional marketing world, SEO and Adwords, and the new techniques of growth-hacking, with a heavy emphasis on data and analysis to run experiments and validate hypotheses.

What You'll Do
- Understand Knack users and the competitive market landscape.
- Know the product roadmap and market trends intimately to help devise, plan, and execute strategies and tactics in additional to product launches, to drive awareness and new trials of Knack.
- Manage online marketing efforts including SEO and content marketing.
- Manage the execution of marketing tactics to support audience-specific strategies—everything from blogs, infographics, videos, tweets to landing page messaging – we want you to think outside the box.

What We’re Looking For
- A deep understanding of SaaS analytical numbers like LTV, CAC, Churn, etc.
- Experience in online marketing areas like SEO, content marketing, and PPC campaigns.
- Demonstrated customer focus, with an ability to understand, simplify, and communicate complex ideas
￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼- Analytical skills: analyze user data and implement appropriate tracking to measure marketing success
- A desire to be a part of a long-term, profitable business that makes a great product loved by thousands of customers.

About Knack

Knack is a no-code platform that makes it easy for anyone to build applications and workflows to do amazing things with their data.

Knack launched in 2012 and has been growing steadily as we’ve built our team, perfected our product, and nailed our product-market fit. We’re now ready to take things to the next level and maximize the opportunity for what this product can be.

So why are we different?

We’re bootstrapped: we’ve had to build something our customers actually pay for. This changes how you do things.

We’re 100% remote: and have been from the beginning. Every decision we’ve made has been based around optimizing our remote operations.

We’re small: and we like it that way. We’re more than just chat avatars-- we’ve all gotten to know each other, have grown together, and love working with each other.

We enjoy the journey: we’re in this for the long haul. We’re not chasing an exit or the next round of funding. We’re building something we’re proud of and want to keep improving on.

You can read more about Knack and the team here.

Benefits & Compensation

Define your work: our only rule is our overlap zone of 11am to 4pm EST. Otherwise find the location, environment, and schedule that is best for your life and work. It’s not about separation, it’s about optimization.

Unlimited Paid Vacation: take the time you need to stay motivated, charged, and balanced. You’ll get forced days off for birthdays and knackiversaries.

Paid Corporate Retreats: we get together twice a year at amazing locations to do normal human being things in person. We pay for your flight, lodging, and meals.

Learning Credits: an annual allowance is provided to stay on top of your game with classes, books, and conferences.

HealthCare: we offer health, vision, and dental, covering 75% of the premium for you and your dependents (spouse + children).

Pangea is seeking an investment professional who is excited about the intersection of real estate and blockchain. The individual will be a thoughtful, intelligent and well-rounded investment professional who has a deployed capital in real estate in individual assets and/or REITs. The individual will be involved in the early days of Pangea and have end-to-end responsibility for various real estate asset investments from sourcing, due diligence, acquisition, to asset management. · Deal Generation - contact banks, private lenders, and other creditors regarding specific leads to gauge interest in transacting. Lead offers, negotiate deals, and follow through to closing.

· Property Operations - ensure collateral is protected, oversee court appointed receivers, and manage property level renovations and operations.
· Manage existing pipeline of assets

items.content:
Product Owner (m/f) Passenger App

Company: mytaxi DE
Location: Hamburg, DE
Level: Intermediate
Language: English
Product/Project Management
Skills:
  • Databases
  • Product Management
  • Product Owner

  • Scrum

    • Intro

    Do you want to proactively contribute to designing the future of mobility? Are you interested in optimising and developing a key component of the mytaxi business in a challenging role with a lot of responsibility? If the answer is yes, then we have the right role for you.

    As Product Manager (m/f) of the mytaxi Passenger App, you are responsible for the product development and coordination of new feature implementation in the mytaxi Passenger App, that is used by millions of mytaxi passengers all over Europe. Your work will contribute directly to the ongoing success and growth of mytaxi in one of the most dynamic market environments of our times.

    Your role:

    • You will be responsible for the development and improvement of the mytaxi products in our Headquarter in Hamburg.
    • You will work closely with the product department and various stakeholders across Europe.
    • You are able to think like different customer and stakeholder groups such as Passengers, Drivers as well as internal users, and adapt to their needs. You can synthesize multi-channel feedback and understand risks and opportunities in order to identify customers’ problems and needs.
    • You will be able to recognize opportunities immediately and transfer them into new product concepts.
    • Together with our developers, Prioritization Committees, Designers and stakeholders you will work on feature specifications and roadmaps
    • You think as a European and can adapt and understand different cultures and market environments. Traveling to our offices around Europe is key.
    • You will conceptualize new products to bring them to life with a team of developers and verify their success in our markets through working with Business Intelligence, executing A/B Tests and overseeing UX/UI research.
    • You will gather new requirements, analyze and rate them on a quantitative and qualitative level before prioritizing them based these findings.
    • You will work closely with our Teams to improve the development process across our European markets
    • Knowledge sharing is your passion, sharing new information is your key to success.
    • You will work together with the entire product department (UX/UI, Business Analysts and other Product Managers) to develop the product vision and spread it throughout the whole organisation.
    • You will proactively live our values and act as an ambassador for your product.

    Main requirements

    • You are a problem solver, detail-oriented and self-motivated who thrives in a fast-paced, highly dynamic environment. Further key aspects of your profile are:

      • Several years of experience in agile software development, you can demonstrate your hands on mentality
      • Substantial experience in software product management, you can demonstrate team management, skill in product prioritisation, creating a roadmap, and product delivery
      • Expertise in the field of mobility markets would be perfect.
      • You conceive immediately what makes a product successful and can conceptualize pragmatic solutions.
      • You are eager to develop products our external and internal customers and users love.
      • You hold profound expertise in different procedure models of software development - especially Scrum and Kanban.
      • You are open to trying out new things and are driven to optimize products and processes alike.
      • It is in your nature to identify challenges directly
      • You are an empathic communicator and can motivate your team
      • As a team player, you keep up high standards of communication and your sense of humor even in demanding and fast moving situations
      • Fluent proficiency in English and German

    Perks

    • Great learning and development opportunities through internal and external workshops
    • Monthly mobility allowance for free taxi rides
    • Pension plan
    • Subsidised public transport ticket
    • Free language courses
    • Be part of motivated and innovative team with flat hierarchies and the chance to bring in your own ideas
    • Have your birthday off!
    • Flexible working hours
    • 4 Team events per year
    • All the usual start-up goodies like fruit, unlimited soft drinks, after-work beers
