items.content:
Senior Marketing Designer

Designer
Anywhere
Company: Buffer
Full Time

Overview

The Buffer marketing team delights in helping people grow their businesses and advocating for a more humane workplace. We are a cohesive, dedicated, fun-loving bunch who are committed to driving awareness for the Buffer brand and acquiring customers for the Buffer product. We emphasize high-quality work. We value respect, trust, and affirmation. We want each teammate to feel fulfilled in their work. Want to join us? We’d love to meet you.

Our marketing efforts reach more than 10 million people each year and bring in more than 30,000 new Buffer users each month. 

We’d love to welcome a marketing designer to the team to help shape our brand and deliver a high-quality experience to our audience and our customers!

FULL-TIME · REMOTE

Buffer is an equal opportunity employer. We’re united by Buffer’s values, and we celebrate our unique differences. As a remote team, we’re lucky to be have the chance to add teammates from anywhere in the world!

We value creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and are actively working on building a culture where underrepresented groups can flourish. People from non-traditional backgrounds are especially invited to apply!

What You’ll Do:
  • Own the visual communication of the Buffer brand across all digital channels.
  • Refine and expand our brand kit, UI kit, and style guide. Get to know the vision and and translate these into brand elements that are cohesive, modern, and inviting.
    • values of Buffer
  • Create brand assets such as logos, iconography, illustrations, color palettes, patterns and other design elements when needed. Work on a range of ambitious projects including, but not limited to, identity design and systems, web design, UI/UX design, content graphics, social media graphics, event collateral, print materials, internal collateral, infographics, storyboards, and illustrations.
  • Execute design requests in a timely manner and at an impeccable quality.
  • Help the team produce its best work by clearly communicating brand guidelines  regarding typography, color, layout, and art direction.
  • Ensure Buffer visual design and brand consistency in all assets by producing high-quality visual designs and illustrations yourself or assisting the team with rules and templates to follow.
  • Stay informed about competitors, best practices, existing initiatives, past projects, and customer research. Use data about the customer experience and visitor experience to improve designs across all digital channels.

    • Helpful Skills and Experience
    • Direct experience developing brand guidelines, designing responsive web pages and sites, creating marketing collateral and ad campaigns, and leading a brand. (In many cases, this will mean you have been doing this work for years. We’re also open to hearing from you if you show a high level of competence, regardless of experience. As a general guideline, successful candidates typically have 3+ years of experience.)
    • A beautiful portfolio to share, with examples of brand guidelines/style guides you’ve created and the pages and graphics you’ve built using those guides.
    • Strong design sense, a solid understanding of color theory and type theory, and ability to articulate why a design works (or doesn’t).
    • Ability to create assets and templates given a set of brand guidelines, and own and evolve those brand guidelines in accordance with the vision of the company.
    • High level of competency in at least one major design package (Illustrator, Photoshop, Sketch, Figma, etc).
    • A good understanding of how designs impact conversion and brand awareness. Good instinct for content and copy is a plus!
    • Ability to rapidly execute campaigns and experiments while championing a high degree of polish,  accuracy and attention to detail.
    • Experience with UX/UI design and a passion for designing delightful user journeys.

      • What We Value

      Clear communication, , open-mindedness, empathy and patience are just a few of Buffer’s . We are looking for a person who understands this culture and will thrive within a team of people passionate about self-improvement, honesty and openness.  on how we strive to communicate with customers.

      transparencycultural valuesHere’s a guide

      Working at Buffer is collaborative and positive thanks to our core values. We try to be “No Ego Doers” who are aware of our assumptions, and joining us means you’ll work together with the team in order to test and confirm our ideas. In our , we choose to focus on the journey, the growth and evolution that is a career.

      career framework

      Perks and Benefits

      We hope that you’re excited by the possibilities that come with working at Buffer! In addition to our unique culture, we also offer these fun perks and benefits.

      • Technology: Get hooked up with a laptop to do your best work.
      • Learning & development stipend: To encourage our teammates to be their best selves, we offer a small stipend for any course or training they’d like to do.
      • Health insurance: We offer health insurance for all of our team members, international or US based.
      • Salary: Our salary formula adjusts to your cost of living and experience. For this role, the range is $81k – $96k USD per year.
      • Work remotely: Live and work from wherever you feel happiest.
      • Stock options: Joining the Buffer journey means you can choose to own part of the company.
      • Unlimited time off: Our only policy is that you give yourself a break regularly.
      • Retreats: Join us on annual international company retreats! Our last retreat was in Singapore.
      • Free books (and Kindle): All you can read, no questions asked.
      • Family Leave: If your family grows during your time at Buffer, we recommend taking 3 months of family leave, regardless of when you joined.

        • Where You’ll Work

        Buffer is a fully distributed team, which means that we’re spread across the planet. We have Bufferoos in 15 countries, 11 timezones and 42 cities around the world to build a great culture and product. You’ll work where you’re happiest and most productive, in the place that helps you to become the person you wish to be.

        More about how we work remotely →

        See where the Buffer team is now →

        Here’s our tentative transparent hiring timeline:

        Apply to join the team! We’ll spend time reviewing applications  Follow-up interviews with the team

        August 24 to Sept. 21: 
        Sept. 24 to Oct. 5: 
        Oct. 8-19:



        Let's do this! Apply for this job at the URL below.

        Please reference Jobspresso in your job application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

        https://journey.buffer.com/marketing-designer/en →

Instead, our all-remote team works closely with customers to highlight what's possible with our software — from conducting virtual product tours to sharing product management best practices drawn from personal experience.

We are looking for a high-energy product leader who is ready to take a huge career leap forward. If this is you, we want to hear from you!

items.content:
Technical Marketing Engineer


Auth0


Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

Auth0 is loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. More than 500.000 unique users visit Auth0.com each month due to our compelling content and the functionality of our identity platform. Our mission is to simplify developers' lives, improve security, and reduce identity TCO for our enterprise customers, by making identity simple, secure and extensible.

The Product Marketing team is recruiting a Technical Marketing Engineer who can drive actionable insights based on “deep dive analyses” of various competing platforms in the IAM (Identity and Access Management) landscape. If you are passionate about technology, analyzing competing products in the market, and if you love to be “hands-on” with the product, then you would be our ideal candidate for this position. This role will interface primarily with the Product Management, Sales, Field enablement and Marketing teams and reports into the Director of Product Marketing.

Responsibilities:


* Build apps for existing and new features/products and deliver actionable insights.

* Maintain a broad and deep technical understanding of the Auth0 product line and the underlying technologies and protocols.

* Support the Marketing team in the formulation of battle cards, competitive slides and other field enablement tools to improve the effectiveness of the pre-sales team.

* Collaborate with Product Management as an internal consultant and drive critical insights such as feature gap analysis and platform positioning.

* Gather market data on an ongoing basis in a structured fashion to understand the competitive landscape and emerging threats/opportunities.

* Support the development of internal and external training resources.




Requirements:


* 2+ years of related, relevant experience in solutions engineering, pre-sales, developer evangelism, competitive intelligence, or technical product marketing.

* Effective communicator for both a technical and a business level audience.

* Experience with at least two programming languages, one of them being JavaScript, ideally the other a statically-typed language.

* Experience with at least one backend stack (eg. .NET, Java).

* Experience with a popular frontend stack (eg. Angular).

* Experience building a full stack application (frontend SPA or mobile app, backend REST API, database).

* Proven ability to analyze markets, products and competitors and translate that information into actionable intelligence, positioning campaigns and sales tools.

* Experience with at least two database storage engines (eg. SQL Server, Oracle), is a plus.

* Experience with at least one standard network security protocol (eg. OAuth, OAuth2, SAML, LDAP) is a plus.

* Experience in Identity and Access Management (IAM) is a plus.




Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Auth0 participates in E-Verify and will confirm work authorization for candidates residing in the United States.

See more jobs at Auth0

items.title: Technical Product Manager
items.content:
Technical Product Manager


Citrusbyte


Company Overview


Citrusbyte is a team of craftspeople and experts who build amazing products and believe in cultivating a high degree of leadership in all of our people. We build medium and large-scale applications that solve our customers' business-critical problems.


Job Summary


We're looking for an experienced product manager to join the team at Citrusbyte. It is expected that you have lived the full product lifecycle, having brought multiple products to market.


In this role, you will lead a team of  10-14 engineers operating in small squads of 2-3 engineers and work directly with a research and design team and customer technical leads to build complex custom software applications.


Responsibilities and Duties


As a product manager supporting the technical development of a product, you are responsible for communicating the overall product guidance, vision, and prioritization, planning, and stakeholder communication. As the voice of the product, you will help the engineers organize incremental releases that achieve the product's short-term goals and align with the product's long-term vision.  You've got to be a quick study and become a domain expert in the areas required for your products: You need to know the business opportunities, competitors, customer pain points and technical details about each product. The Product Manager is also a guide. Clients and engineerings will look to you to chart out the approach that will deliver business-driven results within a committed time and budget.


You will work closely with our designers who actually do the design & wireframing but you should be able to roll up your sleeves to create and make changes to wireframes yourself.



* Strategy: Collecting research, running project kickoffs, and defining business goals 

* Consulting: Guiding client stakeholders and program management teams through the right steps to build  a world-class product that meets the product's business goals

* Design: Coordinate directly with UX/UI designers and engineering leads to ensure technical feasibility of proposed designs and refine user stories for engineers to execute the build

items.content:
A few years ago, we recognised both the need for employer engagement within schools and a careers platform to help combat the national skills shortage within the STEM industries. We’re pretty good at multitasking, so we thought we’d do something about them both.

We grafted and created Springpod, a platform connecting school students with companies within the science, tech, engineering and maths industries and building those all-important bridges between schools and employers.

We now work with the leading tech and engineering firms in the UK, as well as schools across the length and breadth of the UK, helping thousands of students secure their dream career every year.

We’re up and running at the early stages of our journey. But what’s our long-term mission and goal? We aim high and want to enable every student in the UK to connect with an employer so they can achieve their dream destination, all before they leave school.

*Fancy joining our mission?*
We are searching for a creative, highly organised, multi-disciplined and data-driven Content Marketing Manager who is passionate about our mission of helping young people find their dream career.

You’ll work closely with our Commercial Director to devise and implement a strategy that will drive growth (acquisition, activation, engagement & retention) of:

* Students aged between (13-18)
* School careers teachers
* Employers

You’ll also play a key role in client meetings, coming up with content ideas to help our employer partners attract and educate students through Springpod.

*Responsibilities*
* Accountable for all content marketing initiatives to drive traffic, user engagement and user retention
* Reporting back to management on user acquisition, activation, engagement & retention metrics
* Managing external freelancers; writers and designers
* Managing content partnerships with industry thought-leaders
* Management and implementation of our content and editorial calendar
* Day to day management of all digital channels
* Attending client meetings (if required) to present content ideas
* Executing content plans and working closely with our employer partners to promote

*Who we’re looking for:*
* You have 1-3 years’ content marketing experience, working for an internet, online community, SaaS or agency business
* Good understanding of SEO, content development, social media, email and analytics
* You have impeccable writing skills and experience creating engaging content (short form, long form, video & infographics)
* You have experience with marketing automation & analytics tools such as; Autopilot, HubSpot, Amplitude, Mixpanel and Google Analytics (Not all required)
* Ability to manage external freelancers; writers and designers
* Have confidence dealing with clients and are good under pressure
* You are very organised, motivated, hardworking and sociable

*Benefits:*

* Competitive salary and incentives
* Fast-paced startup environment with a lot of responsibility and self-management
* Very sociable team – fortnightly team meals & weekly drinks on the beer mile
* Luxury working environment – in the heart of Bermondsey
* The ability to work remotely some of the time if desired
* Training & CPD budget

To apply, please submit your CV and an explanation of why you feel passionate about our mission of helping young people find their dream career.

items.title: Growth Marketer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
At Flock we’re having our very own ‘rocketship’ moment, growing faster than we ever imagined. We’re now looking for an experienced, results-driven Growth Marketer to head up our performance marketing efforts.

Over the last two years we’ve reinvented insurance from the ground up. And it’s working. Since launching Flock Cover (our pay-as-you-fly drone insurance app) we have on-boarded over 2,000 active users, maintaining exponential growth and delighting our customers in the process. We have embraced experimentation and tested exciting marketing initiatives, growing through a combination of partnerships, word-of-mouth, and online buzz. Now it’s time to take this up a notch. And that’s where you come in...

You will be overseeing our paid and unpaid marketing activities, both online and offline.

You’ll find and test new channels with a laser focus on our CPA, identifying and re-doubling efforts on whatever works. What would the CPA for Flock be of sponsoring drone conferences? Giving away free flights? Or flying marketing-drones over London? You’ll get to test your assumptions, both working alone, with the entire Flock team, or with our existing multinational partners, to identify and carve out a successful marketing strategy.

Key Responsibilities

Supercharge the growth of Flock’s user base, focusing on core metrics (such as the number of policies we sell per day).
Analyse our reams of existing data to produce genuinely impactful insights.
Engage with our customers to understand the areas that we need to improve on.
Work with Flock’s data team to identify new usage-based KPIs.
Experiment with different marketing channels (online and offline) to discover what strategies work best in our industry.
Set up and run highly effective campaigns across all the channels we work with (and others that we might have missed).
Generate new marketing and growth ideas, and engage the rest of the team to implement them.
Collaborate with our product and tech teams, to identify and spec out new product features that will help Flock grow faster and retain users more reliably.
Your first 30 days

We imagine your first month will look something like this:

Comprehensive onboarding to the industry, our customers and our product with the help of the whole Flock team
Map out Flock’s existing marketing and growth efforts, and resulting attribution
Deep-dive into Flock’s acquisition funnel, identifying missed opportunities and easy wins
Develop and execute on five growth experiments with the support of our product and marketing teams

You should apply if some (or all) of the following are true:

You’ve got demonstrable experience exponentially growing the user base and sales of a new product.
You are data-driven, always looking to understand the numbers behind everything you do.
You enjoy working in teams, but can also work well on your own, and you’re happy to get your hands dirty.
You are an excellent communicator, and enjoy the challenge of making the complex seem simple.
You’re more than able to multitask and adapt quickly to new situations.
You’re happy to take ownership of a task from end to end.
You have experience across a range of online and offline platforms (search, social, direct mail, email, etc.)
You have a wealth of experience using data-tracking technologies.
You have set-up and run successful digital ad campaigns.

Our Process

Apply on this page. Please explain (briefly) why you’re interested in this position and why you believe you’re the right person for this job, providing examples of your past achievements (if possible).
We will schedule you in for an initial 10-minute phone conversation with Antton (Product Lead and founder).
We will send over a short exercise for you to complete. This will test a range of skills, from technical to creative. No right or wrong answers here; we’re more interested in understanding your approach.
You will be invited for an engaging on-site interview where you will present your exercise answers to various members of the team, including Antton, and Ed (CEO).
Meet the entire team in a very casual setting for a friendly chat!

Benefits

Remuneration

Competitive salary
Options: we want you to own the work that you do. And this means owning the company you work in. All employees receive options as part of their compensation package.
Pension: we offer a full auto-enrollment workplace pension for all employees who want it. Nothing fancy here. Just a pension.

Work-life balance

Large amounts of autonomy and empowerment in your work
Holidays: we offer 33 days of holiday per annum, including bank holidays.
Flexible working / working from home: we don’t have fixed working hours, some of our team start at 8am, others at 10am. We trust you to establish an effective working pattern that allows you to excel in your role and makes you a great Flock team member.

Learning & Development

Books, courses and conference budgets for all employees
Hackathons: we run a quarterly hackathon which lasts 24 hours. Everyone’s invited to join in.
Breakfast club: learn from your colleagues (or teach us something new!)

Perks

Friday fancy lunches: every Friday the entire Flock teams heads for lunch together. We call it ‘fancy lunch’. But sometimes it’s just at a pub.
Quarterly offsite adventures: every quarter the entire team do something crazy together. Like fly a plane to the coast. Unlimited coffee, tea and fresh fruit every day

* Track, report, and analyze website analytics and PPC initiatives and campaigns

The tickr Team

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Contact us remotejobr->gmail.com

Talent Relations Manager

Headquarters: Columbus, Ohio
URL: www.bemyguest.fm

Be My Guest is growing and hiring a full-time Talent Relations Manager to join our team!

What We Do

Be My Guest is a podcast outreach and booking agency for entrepreneurs, authors, CEO’s, executives, and personal brands (professional YouTubers, bloggers, podcasters, etc.).

We get our clients booked on podcasts that reach their ideal customers and readers so they can get more publicity, grow their audience, and drive sales of their products and services.

Why Podcasting?

Podcasts are arguably the fastest-growing digital media segment. There are 200 million radio listeners in the United States, and 70 million podcast listeners. Over the next 10 years those numbers will continue to converge, until podcasting takes over as the primary audio distribution channel that consumers listen and pay attention to.

Podcasting is just getting started, and there aren't many companies building expertise around it. If you work in PR or marketing, you need to build skills in podcasting. The Talent Relations Manager will have an opportunity to be a big part in shaping the future of Be My Guest as we continue our journey in becoming a world-class podcast agency.

Job Description

We’re looking to hire a full-time Talent Relations Manager to help support our growing client base.

You’ll be working directly with our co-founders Erik and Jonathan to help our clients grow their businesses through podcast guest appearances (these interviews will be listened to by thousands of people).

This roles requires excellent research, organizational, and communication skills. This is a client facing role, so interpersonal skills are a must.

Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include:

  • Identify the perfect podcasts for our clients to appear as a guest on using our podcast database and based on the client’s expertise and goals
  • Craft personal and compelling email pitches to podcast hosts in order to obtain a guest appearance for our clients on their show (we have a system for doing this)
  • Manage a Trello board of client interviews (upcoming, completed, need to follow-up, live, etc.)
  • Correspond with clients about new interviews you have booked for them
  • Schedule our clients podcast interviews according to both the client and podcaster’s schedule (ensuring the ideal interview times for each of them)
  • Ensure our clients have the prep and interview details needed prior to every interview

Who You Are:

  • You have an upbeat, bubbly, and friendly personality that shines in email and phone communication with our clients and podcasters.
  • You take pride in creating engaging emails (this will be your primary duty in this role)
  • You don’t cut corners to make your life easier (you spend as much time as needed on something to get results)
  • Coachable/no ego - happy doing high level projects as well as mundane administrative tasks
  • Excellent at project management and can successfully complete multiple projects occurring at the same time (attention to detail test - use the word "joy" somewhere in your application).
  • A self motivated hard worker (we work remotely)
  • Compassionate / Empathetic
  • Easily handles unpredictability
  • Comfortable taking initiative and asking questions
  • You’re a podcast fan :)
  • Experience in PR, Media Relations, or Account Management is preferred but not required
  • Must live in the United States

Benefits & Compensation:

  • While we do get together in person occasionally, we’re primarily a remote company (you can work anywhere you want - from your house, favorite coffee shop, coworking space, etc. :)).
  • This is a full-time 40 hour per week contract position

How to Apply:

In order to apply for this position, please follow the steps below exactly as they are listed:

1. Create a Google Doc for your application. Keep it well organized and easy to digest.

2. Include the following

  • Name
  • Email
  • Phone number
  • URL of your Linkedin profile (if you have one)
  • URL of your website (if you have one)
  • URL of your Twitter (if you have one)
  • URL of your Instagram (if you have one)

3. Answer the following survey questions in the Google Doc:

  • After reading the job description, why do you feel you are a strong fit? Sell us on why we should hire you over everyone else. What differentiates you from your peers?
  • What have you improved on most during the last year, and what would you like to improve upon next?
  • What were the top 3 accomplishments in your last 2 jobs?
  • Do you have experience in PR, media relations, or as an account manager? If yes, briefly tell me about it.
  • Do you listen to non-fiction podcasts or read blog posts. If so, what are some of your favorites?
  • What is your work availability and desired work schedule? Please be as specific as possible with your availability on a day / week basis.
  • What is your desired salary?
  • Where did you hear about this job posting?
  • Is there anything else we should know about you?

4. Send your application in one email to [email protected] and [email protected]

  • The subject line should read “BMG Talent Relations Manager: YOUR NAME”
  • The body of the email should include a link to the Google Doc and nothing else.

To apply: Send your application in one email to erik@bemyguest.fm and jonathan@bemyguest.fm.

items.content:
Product Manager // Stillpoint Connect

Company: Stillpoint Connect

Tags:
  • Product Management

    • Position Product Manager at Stillpoint Connect

    Stillpoint Connect is a company based in Zurich with a mission to enable access to psychology for individual clients and organizations around the world. Stillpoint builds on the accumulated clinical expertise embodied by its diverse international community of affiliated clinicians (counselors, psychologists, psychoanalysts, psychotherapists) and its affiliate, Prairie Care, a leading group in the mental health sector operating a network of psychiatric care facilities in Minneapolis and the San Francisco Bay Area in California.

    Integrated within a community of mental-health providers, Stillpoint has built its own platform for online practice management enabling member-users to conduct the key operations of their practice online (encrypted messaging, booking, billing, record-keeping, audio-video conferencing) and to connect with clients all over the world.

    Stillpoint Connect is also licensing reputable corporate clients with customized versions of its continuously evolving platform in order to facilitate a seamless provision of psychology-related services to individual and/or third entity clients.

    The team is composed of scientists and tech people who love working together on challenging problems in tech health. We are equally proud of what we do and how we do it.

    WHO ARE YOU?

    We are looking for a person that has worked in early stage startups before, and understands the challenges of working in smaller teams with multiple roles and some occasional chaos.

    We expect that the engineering team will grow with the company in the next couple of years, so the responsibilities of this role are likely to evolve. You will work together with the CTO.

    YOU WILL

    • Drive product development with a cross-functional team to provide the best possible experience for our users and to build a scalable infrastructure.
    • Own the backlog, roadmap and vision of the platform and its underlying technology, including our backend infrastructure, payment integration and internal tools.
    • Make sure we follow an informed decision making process by listing to users, looking into data and gather partners feedbacks and requirement.
    • Be the interface person for our partners; you must mange their expectations, make sure they are informed about relevant development achievement
    • Make sure the communication flow between all the stakeholders is smooth and up to date; no emails or relevant communication pieces will slip out of your inbox.
    • Be point of contact among all the stakeholders of the project, you must own all the relevant information and give assess to them upon request.
    • Manage and communicate with internal stakeholders and external partners around the implementation of the counselling platform and its infrastructure.

    YOU HAVE

    • Self-starter/self-organizer mindset and a good understanding of business needs.
    • 3+ years of experience as a product manager working on a tech product.
    • Experience of leading a remote team and several stakeholders. The ability to switch between priorities.

    YOU ARE

    • Fluent in English and preferably Italian
    • An empathic person that deeply cares for product\’s success and likes to collaborate closely with designers, engineers, business people, and other internal stakeholders.
    • Well organised and know how to separate noise from the important things even in busy times.
    • Not afraid of making decisions, take the consequences.
    • Comfortable saying no.
    • Own your project/product from the whole picture to the small details.

    WHY STILLPOINT CONNECT?

    • You will redefine the way people use counselling
    • You have impact on the company success
    • A great team you will have fun working with
    • You will be immersed in an exciting learning environment
    • A competitive salary
    • Flexible working hours, possibility to work from remote or in a great office location in Berlin and/or Zurich
    • Preferably looking for people willing to work as freelancers.

    If you feel excited about the idea of being part of Stillpoint Connect we are looking forward to receiving your application at zurich@stillpointspaces.com.

items.content:
*What is our purpose in this world?*

*events,efficient,easy*
Evendo redefines the way we plan and do events. Think “Booking.com for events” with a built-in planning tool on top, and an app-based assistant guiding participants through the actual events.

Evendo is the world’s first end-to-end event platform, facilitating effortless planning, streamlined booking, and the seamless execution of events, through its innovative and intuitive design. There is currently no identifiable match or competition to Evendo worldwide.

*The opportunity*
This is an exciting time in our history and we are now looking to scale quickly. For the right profile, it is a great time to join and be part of an amazing journey. We are looking for a superhero with online acquisition powers and with an interest in the event market to join our team and be our SEO & SEM expert.

*The profile we are looking for*
This is a pivotal role and involves working as part of the Content Team been responsible for the production of soft content (smashing landing pages which will increase conversion), and alongside Analytics Team being responsible for driving increased qualified organic traffic on Evendo.com using best practices and up to date technologies.
You will develope a clear SEM strategy and executing on this - showing clear ROI.

*Main responsibilities*
* Execute tests, collect and analyze data and results, identify trends and insights in order to achieve maximum ROI in paid search campaigns;
* Track, report, and analyses website analytics and PPC initiatives and campaigns;
* Manage campaign expenses, staying on budget, estimating monthly costs and reconciling discrepancies;
* Optimize copy and landing pages for search engine marketing;
* Perform ongoing keyword discovery, expansion and optimisation;
* Research and implement search engine optimisation recommendations;
* Research and analyse competitor advertising links;
* Develop and implement link building strategy;
* Work with the development team to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented on newly
developed code;
* Work with editorial and marketing teams to drive SEO in content creation and content programming;
* Recommend changes to website architecture, content, linking and other factors to improve SEO
positions for target keywords;

*Role requirements*
* Proven SEO experience;
* Proven SEM experience managing PPC campaigns across various search engines;
* Solid understanding of performance marketing, conversion, and online customer acquisition;
* In-depth experience with website analytics tools (e.g, Google Analytics, Tag Manager);
* Experience with bid management tools;
* Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments ( e.g, Optimizely);
* Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints;
* Knowledge of ranking factors and search engine algorithms;
* Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO and SEM;
* No 9 -to-5 mentality.

*Evendo is looking for a special “you”*
* you want to succeed and have a high personal drive.
* you are a go-getter and see opportunities rather than obstacles.
* you are a no-quitter and don’t stop until you have reached your goal
* you are aware of the consequences of producing sub-standard and you do not want to put your colleagues in a position, where they will have to deal with your mistakes
* you are aware that making a wrong decision is better than making no decision – and just as you will be ready to do whatever it takes to help and assist your colleagues if they fail, you expect the same from them
* you are a team-player and you know that no company is stronger than the weakest link (and you don’t want it to be you).
* you have the guts to speak up and the courtesy to know when to shut up
* you keep your promises
* you are flexible and want to expand your horizon by learning new things all the time
* you raise your hand first when a new task is given to the team

If you recognize yourself in the above and want to be a part of a journey conquering the world, we will be looking forward to welcoming you in Evendo.

*About Evendo*
Evendo was founded in 2015 by experienced entrepreneurs with several international success stories – including the Sitecore growth phenomenon.

Evendo has been testing the Danish market since August 2016. During this period, Evendo has easily become the largest and fastest-growing event portal in Denmark with an impressive customer-base and a rapid increase in market positioning. During the first year of operations, more than 50,000 event experiences were booked through Evendo.

The parent company, Evendo AB, is listed on the Swedish stock exchange ‘Spotlight Stock Market’.

*Working environment:* international team / ambitious start-up organization
*Office location:* Canary Wharf London
*Spoiler alert:* dogs bellow 5kg will be daily at the office.
*This is not a job suitable for: working from home, freelancers, consultants, digital agencies*

items.title: Marketing Manager at Fast Growing, Award Winning, Sustainable and Ethical Brand
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Marketing Manager at Fast Growing, Award Winning, Sustainable and Ethical Brand

Is this you?
We are looking for a marketing manager to take the reins of all things digital marketing and brand at our company Supreme Creations and label Bags of EthicsTM. This could not be a more exciting time to join, and help drive growth for us, given the topical issues of sustainability, single-use plastic, and ethical manufacture.
This incredible opportunity is designed for someone who has at least 4+ years of core marketing experience in digital, is highly analytical, has a creative eye, brand management experience, strong skills in project management, and a global outlook. Belief in our mission is critical to our joint success.

Who we are
We are the world’s largest ethical manufacturer of reusable bags, and sustainable promotional textiles – everything from branded tote bags, to eco-packaging for luxury goods, to printed home textiles. For over 20 years Supreme Creations has been supplying some of the world’s best brands including Nike, Topshop, London Fashion Week and Tesco. Our headquarters are in London, and manufacturing base in South India – we own the entire supply chain. Our Bags of Ethics label represents our ethical and environmental efforts – 9 out of 10 of our workforce in India are women, many of whom are the main breadwinners in their families. Our philosophy is “Don’t Be Boring” – be creative, care for others, and don’t forget the environment.

Your responsibilities
• Help create and execute the company’s marketing strategy while identifying marginal gains and growth hacking opportunities in all our markets
• Produce high quality content for our websites, database, and social media platforms including blogs, newsletters, whitepapers, videos, images
• Project manage and coordinate between a remote team of 2- 4 marketing assistants, as well as freelancers (photographers, videographers, graphic designers) for daily, weekly, monthly campaigns
• Create and execute email marketing strategies for all our markets (UK + international) that drives conversion, customer retention, and loyalty to grow the business
• Manage, analyse and track our efforts on our websites (Google Analytics + other reporting tools) whilst working with our development team to improve user conversions
• Assist in delivering budget optimisations for our paid advertising (PPC on Google and social channels)
• Have a strong understanding of Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) and Conversion Rate Optimisation (CRO) via best practices across all web assets, and execute ways to improve organic ranking
• Planning, originating, co-ordinating, and optimising our B2B marketing activity across social media, and other channels – in particular Instagram, LinkedIN, Facebook, Pinterest, and Youtube with the aim of generating high quality leads for the sales team
• Coordinate creative campaigns (in-house) or on shoots (outside) –working with models, products, and brand ambassadors
• Create low cost brand partnerships with clients and influencers
• Produce high quality reports which are backed by both qualitative and quantitative analysis
• Work with focus groups/ customers/ sales team to improve our communication strategies, product or service
• Understand and keep a track of the latest trends
o Digital trends – latest tools for optimising campaigns, social media listening tools, website optimisation tools
o Design/ fashion/ product trends relevant for the fashion/ print/ packaging/ sustainability industry
o Market and macro trends competitor intelligence, customer trends, and market opportunities


About you
A Quick & Strategic Thinker. Digitally driven. Proactive self-starter. Ambitious. Not a 9-5er. Agile. Focussed. Creative. Care for People & Our Planet.
• Ability to project manage multiple projects, with different people (including freelance/ remote)
• Proven track record in increasing engagement and leads which will generate improved sales
• Proven track record in optimising budgets (digital marketing spends in particular)
• Excellent communication skills, including strong copywriting, editing, and visual skills
• Experience demonstrated with SEO, email marketing, social media, and digital advertising
• Design driven – you love images, creative, and video campaigns (previous experience within a design focussed industry is helpful)
• Back the mission to produce products which are good for the planet, highly reusable, and are beautifully designed
• Have a background in B2B marketing (or understand the marketing distinction between B2B and B2C)
• Commercially astute

Why join us?
• Competitive salary depending on experience
• Opportunity for you to grow the business and grow yourself
• Join an incredible team: our team are international, young at heart, and very positive
• Opportunity to work with our team in India
• Opportunity to work and mentor students with our partner charity Wings of Hope
• Free lunch on Wednesdays
• Very low hierarchy – you will be working with senior management frequently

How and when
Role is office based at our offices in Neasden, North West London (Jubilee Line).
Start date: ASAP
Any questions? Email us at hr@supreme-london.com
We sadly cannot answer questions on the phone.
Please send your CV and cover letter addressed to Smruti Sriram CEO of the company (and portfolio if you have one)

items.content:
Product Manager Growth (m/f)


Komoot

 verified
Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help people all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, empowering our users to explore more of the great outdoors. And we’re good at it: Google and Apple have listed us as one of their Apps of the Year numerous times—and we are consistently ranked amongst the highest-grossing apps in both Google Play and the App Store. To help us to continue to grow the biggest community of outdoor enthusiasts on the planet, we’re looking for an ambitious product manager to join our world-class dev team.

**Your key responsibilities**
* Work hands-on with designers, copywriters and engineers to create convincing and personalized onboarding flows, retention mechanisms and social features.
* Work with SEO and marketing specialists to create funnels that attract and convert highly engaged cyclists and outdoor enthusiasts.
* Run tests, get feedback from users and colleagues, crunch the numbers, and iterate fast on all our platforms, including web, mail, push notifications and apps.
* Be an advocate for both our users and our business, and drive product development that meets award-winning quality standards.

**Why you’ll love it**
* You’ll take over responsibility and ownership of your projects from day one.
* You’ll develop products that will become an integral part of one of the highest-grossing apps—and will be used by millions all over the world.
* We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, our headquarters in Potsdam or anywhere that lies between the time zones UTC-1 and UTC+3.
* You’ll work in a fast-paced startup with strongly motivated and talented co-workers.
* You’ll enjoy the freedom to organize yourself the way you want and work with whichever tools you love.
* You’ll join us for team gatherings in locations like Mallorca or the Bavarian Alps several times a year.

**You will be successful in this position if you**
* Have 3+ years of experience as a product manager for a digital product.
* Have extensive knowledge in optimizing user journeys, conversion funnels and social loops.
* Have proven knowledge of the cycling and outdoor market and their respective customer segments.
* Have an excellent sense of product, design and copy.
* Can turn complex problems into simple experiences, taking care of every little detail.
* Have a structured and methodical way of working and leading complex cross-functional projects.
* Are hungry to learn and challenge yourself.

**Sound like you?**
Send us the following:
* Your CV.
* A little note on why are you interested in working at komoot.
* Work examples: Show us a little about the projects you’ve worked on in the past.
* Feel free to send us something that shows us a little more about what you’re interested in, be it your Twitter/Instagram account or your blog.
* You’ll get bonus points for doing something creative with komoot — we love it when people go the extra mile.

Requirements

Please apply with cover letter and resume through our website.

See more jobs at Komoot

items.content:
Director of Marketing // Tech Open Air Berlin

Company: Tech Open Air Berlin

Tags:
  • management
  • strategy
  • director

    • About TOA

    What started as the world’s first crowdfunded festival seven years ago, turned into a 4-day flagship festival in Berlin and a series of event chapters around the world. We’ve just delivered our 7th festival edition in June 2018 for 21,000 attendees with 100+ Satellite events from across Berlin city, and our Conference covering 6 stages, 24 themes, 10 formats, 100+ Exhibitors at the Haus of Tech, and the long-awaited TOA Night with art and music at its core.

    Our mission is to make you future-proof.

    We are the world’s first crowdfunded conference. Today we are building a global, inclusive platform for knowledge exchange and collaboration.

    We believe that technology is transforming the way we work, live, and relate to others. Next to the challenges this brings, it also catalyzes opportunities for positive change in the world.

    We provide access to the people building impactful technology and who share their expertise with our community for everyone to experience the culture of Generation We.

     

    Your Role

    As our Director of Marketing, you will be responsible for leading the strategy and implementation of TOA’s growth and internationalization via the crucial elements – revenue growth, data & business intelligence, digital marketing & content, community & support as well as brand identity and products.

    What You Get

    Let’s be honest. Protein bars, dog-friendly office, Berlin VIP party lists, cacao ceremonies ain’t gonna cut it here. We all know that being a startup in events is challenging, but we’re offering you to be part of a hypnotic TOA journey. If your wish is to actually make a difference with your work and help shape and build a business, this role is for you.

    Responsibilities

    • Develop marketing strategies in alignment with TOA’s strategy and vision.
    • Lead strategic and operational execution of all marketing activities (data, digital marketing & content, community, brand identity, paid organic search marketing) to support overall TOA’s growth and brand positioning.
    • Recruit and manage TOA’s marketing team making sure they are devoted, mentored, supported and challenged.
    • Create and lead the processes and workflows to spot on opportunities in the market and improve and grow TOA’s brand identity.
    • Own TOA’s marketing budget planning, forecasting and execution.
    • Support other key roles in sales, content, production teams with various levels of experience in best practices in terms of team, strategy, brand identity and product development.

    Who You Are

    • You have a minimum of 10 years experience in marketing and branding strategy, planning and execution roles leading marketing team(s); managing remote team(s) would be a plus.
    • You have experience in entering new markets, positioning a brand and products / services based on channels like digital marketing & content, paid organic search marketing, community building.
    • You have experience in managing the creative tension across key roles in leadership to reach the overall strategy and purpose of the company.
    • You have knowledge, experience and interest in tech and startup ecosystem to quickly react to the latest market, geography and trend shifts.
    • You have complete command of German and English language.
    • You are willing to work on contract basis.
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Product Marketing Manager


Gathercontent

 verified
**What’s the opportunity?**

We've been around 6 years and have built a strong reputation amongst the content strategy community. Through relentless customer development we’ve identified an enormous market opportunity for Content Operations (ContentOps).

ContentOps addresses the gap that exists between content strategy and publishing platforms/traditional CMS'. Without dedicated ContentOps there is complete chaos resulting in poor content, costing organisations time, money and reputation.

We help our customers unify their people, process and content. They're now able to quickly produce and publish effective content at scale; with less headaches, less errors and better results.

Our view is that effective content is going to be prioritised in every business and organisation and well executed ContentOps will be a requirement for this to happen. We’re already seeing this in our roster of customers; from Higher Education to Healthcare, Harvard to the NHS.


**What’s the role?**

You’ll be primarily responsible for helping our existing and prospective customers understand, and get excited, by the value our Content Operations Platform offers. You’ll figure out how to open their eyes to new and better ways of working.

Day-to-day you’ll take ownership over product and feature launches, developing and executing GTM strategies for various verticals and product use-cases. You’ll work closely with our customers to develop a deep understanding of their challenges and discover new ways to tell their stories. You’ll support the sales team to ensure they have everything they need to bring new customers on board and expand existing accounts.

You’ll also help champion the development and popularisation of a new category. You’ll have ownership over your numbers and how you hit them. You’ll obsess over how to position us in the minds of our customers and finally, you’ll continuously improve yourself and support your colleagues.

**What we can offer you:**
* Remote working - we offer the opportunity to work remotely. Whether you want to join a co-working space, work from home or travel: the choice and flexibility are yours.
* Family friendly - the company is very family oriented and understands the necessary flexibility.
* Work/life balance - we work a 35 hour week and encourage downtime. It’s about doing a few things well and not burning ourselves out.
* The chance to make an impact on our business - As a small team there is a big opportunity for everyone to contribute, collaborate and make their mark.
* Fun team - Even though we work remotely, the entire team get together in London every 4 months to eat good food and have fun.
* Stock options and pensions

**What we need in return:**
* Your undivided passion, energy, focus and enthusiasm.
* A self-starter attitude with experience managing and prioritising your own workload.
* An ability to get things done efficiently (whilst maintaining quality): working at a consistent pace.
* A team-player who works as well with others as individually.
* Strong opinions, loosely held - no fear when it comes to inputting ideas and participating in discussions with the team. You must be happy to take critique, self-improve and move forward.
* An iterative approach - We focus on learning and improving our processes as we go.
* Customer focus - You should always be thinking, “What can I be doing to deliver value to our customers?”
* Leave your ego at the door. We’ve got a very collaborative, blame-free culture with a shared focus on what’s best for the company.

Requirements

**How to apply**We’d love to see some examples of your work, your blog (if you have one) and a cover letter with answers to the following questions:* Why do you want to work at GatherContent?* Can you share a piece of work that you’re proud of, or that you think represents an important part of your philosophy?* Can you tell us about a hard problem you’ve had to solve, and how you went about solving it?* Can you give us a brief description of your background?Also, please include the word ‘blueberry’ in your cover letter to show that you’ve read the job role (helps us weed out time wasters!). We look forward to seeing your application.**What happens next?**We review all of the applications, screen for experience, attention to detail and general suitability.Applicants who are successful will go through a remote/online values interview with two of our team members. If successful, the next step is a remote/online skills interview. Applicants who make it through these stages meet with our Marketing Director in person (in London or Brighton). Travel and expenses will be covered. Finally, you will be given a paid homework assignment to complete.We will then be in touch to let you know if you are successful.**About us**GatherContent is a Content Operations Platform that helps teams produce effective content at scale.Customers use our platform to manage the people and process, for producing content that meets user and business needs.We work with leading digital agencies, higher education institutions, governments, non-profits, membership organisations and many enterprise customers. Some of our customers include Digitas LBI, Harvard University, The Australian Government and Intel.We launched in 2012 and now help thousands of customers, all over the world. Our team is fully remote, working from all over the UK.

Location: United Kindgom

See more jobs at Gathercontent

items.content:
Product Manager, Acquiring Platform

Company: Stripe
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA

Build products to make customers successful.

The Payments Group at Stripe powers Stripe’s core payments-related products such as payment processing, fraud prevention, and Connect.

About the role:

At Stripe, Product Managers help build innovative payments products for our customers. Product development is an extremely collaborative effort between engineering, design, analytics and customer-facing teams. You’d be joining a team of experienced Product Managers who have a track record of successfully building large-scale business and consumer products that are collectively impacting millions of users around the world.

As the Product Manager on the Acquiring Platform team, you’ll work right at the center of Stripe, enabling and expanding the payment capabilities that are core to the Stripe experience.

  • Define and create the critical infrastructure that will power Stripe’s global payment network
  • Develop deep integrations with card networks and financial partners to create new and innovative capabilities
  • Drive the expansion of Stripe’s capabilities around the world
  • Launch a new products and tools that enable new payment experiences for our merchants

You may be a good fit if:

  • You’re a creative product thinker who loves challenging technical problems and collaborates well with engineering, analytics, marketing, and external partners
  • You have experience building or working on technical platforms that enable concurrent development of features by teams located around the world
  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills with a talent for precise articulations of customer problems and infrastructural challenges
  • You have experience working on deeply technical software products from kick-off to ship
  • You do whatever it takes to make your product and team successful whether that means writing a QA plan or hunting down the root cause of a user’s frustration
  • You can turn incomplete, conflicting, or ambiguous inputs into solid action plans
  • Beyond just shipping new products, you obsess about continuous product improvement and can optimize for shipping a portfolio of small, medium and large releases.

Requirements:

  • Experience working in the financial industry where you gained an understanding of financial infrastructure and how financial services differ across the world

What’s it like to work at Stripe?

Stripe is helping the internet fulfill its potential as a platform for economic progress by building software tools that accelerate global economic access and technological development. Stripe makes it easy to start, run and scale an internet business from anywhere in the world.

Stripe is, at its heart, an engineering company. To provide a missing pillar of core internet infrastructure, we hire people with a broad set of technical skills (and from a wide variety of backgrounds) who are ready to take on some of the most challenging problems in the industry – from reliably handling 100M API requests per day, to building adaptive machine learning as a result of years of data science and infrastructure work, and enabling entrepreneurs worldwide to start a global internet business.

We look at Stripe as a constant work in progress and the same is true of our people; for all of us, we believe the best is yet to come. We’re here to support each other in our curiosity and creativity – which we pursue through thoughtful discussion and knowledge-sharing among a diverse set of peers and colleagues.

We encourage all engineers to transition teams once every year and a half and also take on short-term projects with other teams across Stripe. This enables engineers to learn how different parts of Stripe work while also establishing stronger ties and cross-pollination between groups.

We contribute to existing open-source projects and the people working on them, and we release several tools as open-source.

We want to work in a company of warm, inclusive people who treat their colleagues exceptionally well. The kind of people who are committed to going out of their way to help other Stripes in the short-term and pushing them to improve over the long-term (by helping them to get better at what they do).

We’re a highly cross-functional organization and view that as part of the fun: we design our space to encourage as much collaboration as possible. We have long tables in the kitchen for a reason (to enable everyone to meet new people and learn from them). We also have a culture of transparency that we carry through to email communication, ensuring that Stripes all around the world have the information they need to make good local decisions.

In both our products and our people, we aim to reflect, represent and advocate for all of our users, globally. Our users transcend geography, culture and language; what we share, collectively, is a drive to create a fairer, more economically interconnected world.

Guide to the onsite interview 

Apply for this position

https://stripe.com/jobs/positions/product-manager-acquiring-platform

items.title: Product Marketing Manager
items.content:
Product Marketing Manager


Giant Swarm



* Apply Using LinkedIn








We are looking for a Technical Product Marketing Manager

Your Job


* You are our first hire for our Product Marketing. We know that this is a key role in our products success and we want somebody who takes the lead here. We currently have three Product Owners and one Inbound Marketing Manager who closely works with our CEO. With all of them and the entire team you share and communicate your expertise and get things done.

* Our product is used by large enterprises and we have a lot of experience with why and how we do things and we intend on better communicating that, which will be one of your main responsibilities. Of course, you are not alone, but you’ll be taking the lead here.

* You are responsible for the content of our website, the creation of the product related part of sales materials, ebooks, pitch decks, product slides etc. You don’t have to do the organizational part, but enabling the Sales team and training them on our product, features and competitors should be something you are motivated by.

* Together with the Marketing and Content team, you ensure that our customers are informed about new features through product presentations, documentation, e-books and blog posts.






Requirements


* You have worked in Product Marketing before, technical writing will be a plus. Ideally, you have at least 3 years of work experience in a tech-driven environment (best case scenario, you have a background in enterprise software, cloud, open source and distributed systems). You don’t need to be a coder, but basic knowledge of Linux or a little bit of programming will help you understand what we do.

* You can deal with being empowered to make decisions and you like a high amount of self-organization in teams. We'd be happy if you have gained experience in cross-functional teams.

* You have a good grasp on the ecosystem we operate in and you understand the market, product, business, and any constraints involved.

* You like Research! You observe the trends in the ecosystem. You attend conferences and read relevant publications. You should also test-drive competitors solutions for comparison and input.

* You have excellent Communication skills in English and German. You are happy to transform complex technical stuff into simple and intuitive communications.




Why we think this Job is cool


* Impact, Impact, Impact! We are currently a fully remote organization with 25 people with 13 nationalities (located in 9 countries). Every new team member changes the team. This is great! People who know things we don’t are highly welcome.

* You can dive deep into Product Development and Roadmap Creation. You are responsible together with our PO’s how and where new features will be promoted. You are leading here.

* Are you in love with a special topic? No problem. The way we’re organized into SIGs (Special Interest Groups) offer you the freedom to work on things you really love (UX, Security…)

* We serve some of Europe's leading organizations and are talking to many more. We play a key-role in our customers digital transformation. We have partnered up with AWS and Microsoft to provide our solution on their cloud platforms - more will follow. This diverse mix will help you to bring life to the broad field of Product Marketing for Giant Swarm.


See more jobs at Giant Swarm

items.content:
At Midrive, we’re reinventing driving and insurance for the digital generation. The old way of doing things is broken. 53% of learners fail their first test. Of those who pass, 1 in 5 crash in the first 6 months. That’s unacceptable.

Our technology helps learners find top-rated instructors and access pay-as-you-go insurance, so they can pass-first time and ultimately become safer drivers.

Since launch, over 300,000 young people in the UK have used our apps, data and tech to gain their independence. We are growing quickly and are now available in over 100 towns and cities in the UK, expanding to a new one each week.

Founded in 2013, Midrive has raised over £7.5m to date from a respected group of well-connected and supportive investors ‒ including Holiday Extras and Initial Capital. You may have heard about our recent crowdfunding round which was the 4th largest equity fund-raise target in Crowdcube's history.

We’ve recently been named #19 in the Startup 100, the annual ranking of the most game-changing and exciting new businesses launched in the last three years. We were also named ‘Digital Business of the Year’ by the Federation of Small Businesses in 2017.

Want to help us build the future of learner driving and insurance? Then join us!

Find out more about us at Midrive.com

REQUIREMENTS

We’re looking for someone with extensive hands-on experience of Google Adwords search campaign management, which would be their main focus in their current role. Data driven and methodical in their approach to performance marketing, they would have a proven ability to drive swift improvements in campaign performance.

This is an exciting opportunity to have an impact managing performance marketing for a fast growth startup! The purpose of the role is to drive efficiencies and growth in our performance marketing channels, including Adwords paid search and paid social campaigns.


Role objectives:

Build a best-in-class performance optimised paid search strategy.
Draw out actionable insights from performance marketing campaign data.
Analyse and report on campaign performance, refining CPA and ROI on all campaigns.
Plan, execute and report on all performance marketing channel tests and trials.
Develop initiatives to scale performance marketing channels in tandem with Midrive’s instructor supply growth across UK postcode areas.
Constantly seek out and trial relevant new channels.
Ensure all ad copy and creative is optimised to deliver the right message to target audiences, reflecting points of difference, addressing known customer interests and pain points in an engaging way.
Work closely with SEO, content and operations teams to share insights from paid performance.

Key skills and experience:

In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience managing Google Adwords. This is a required skill that you will be tested on, so only apply if you are confident that you meet this requirement.
Working knowledge of Facebook Ads and Google Analytics.
Good understanding of audience targeting and remarketing strategies.
Practical understanding of attribution modelling.
Experience managing large or complex paid performance channel budgets.

About you:

You have lived and breathed Adwords campaign management for at least 1-2 years, and are fully up-to-date with every targeting option and campaign management enhancement in the Adwords interface.
You may have gained your experience at a digital advertising agency, managing paid search campaigns on Google Adwords, or client-side in a B2C direct response focused business.
You find working with data stimulating, and can quickly draw out insights from performance marketing campaign data reports.
With a startup mentality, you are self motivated, a problem solver, ambitious, hard working, collaborative, and want to have an impact on business performance.
Ability to approach tasks as a team, and work in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent attention to detail and a well organised, structured approach to work and the ability to keep projects on track.
You speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.

BENEFITS

At Midrive, we work hard, so that's why we make sure that we have best facilities to play harder! We have a host of perks: Free coffee and snacks, Wednesdays treats, Happy Hour Thursdays, team yoga sessions, and training/sharing sessions. We also have regular fun social events - recent adventures have included a glamping trip, escape rooms, comedy clubs, and silent discos.

Midrive is simply a great place to work. We have a fantastic team of talented people working on an interesting product they are passionate about, and a friendly, social atmosphere. We're also a dog friendly office! Add to that competitive salaries, pension plan, and other perks, it's clear why we're a top choice.

DIVERSITY

Diversity and inclusion are essential values at Midrive. We know we'll do our best and most impactful work when we feel we're represented and we belong. We're proud to actively recruit and hire talented people from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.content:
_*This role is based in Munich*_

*About us*

GoCardless is building a new global network for recurring bank-to-bank payments. We’re cutting out the intermediaries and linking together direct debit schemes from around the world to create a simple way of collecting payments directly from customers’ bank accounts.

We’ve already won noteworthy German customers, including Magicline and Brandnooz, and have partnerships in place with both best-in-class global and German platforms, including Zuora, Sage and Billwerk. We currently process €3.5bn each year for over 30,000 organisations across the UK and Europe - and we’re growing over 100% year on year.

We’re backed by some of the world’s leading investors including Balderton Capital, Accel Partners, Notion Capital, Passion Capital and Y Combinator.

We’re looking for a talented and passionate German Marketing Manager to drive awareness and adoption of GoCardless in Germany. Focusing on our target segments you’ll be responsible for creating and executing on the marketing strategy generating interest and driving leads and revenue.



*Your role*

Working closely with the German General Manager and Sales team, you will be responsible for developing and implementing the German marketing strategy to deliver on the the agreed goals for Germany.
Owning the German marketing budget, you’ll be responsible for planning and implementing specific activities to drive awareness of GoCardless and generate a consistent stream of quality leads and customers to meet the revenue targets.

Supported by the wider Marketing team and a network of freelancers and/or agencies you’ll execute and optimise on campaigns to ensure we’re attracting and retaining the right type of businesses within our core target segments.



*What we're looking for*

We’re looking for a self-starter, excited by an opportunity to grow a rapidly expanding business in a relatively new market. We’d love to hear from you if you have an entrepreneurial spirit, enjoy working in small, autonomous cross-functional teams and are willing go the extra mile to get a job done.

*You should apply if:*

* You have a strong marketing background in B2B businesses in the German market
* You are experienced in working across multiple marketing channels, optimising the mix and the messaging for different audiences
* You are commercially astute and results driven, with strong quantitative analytical skills using tools such as Google Analytics and Tableau
* You have experience and are comfortable owning social media channels and monitoring engagement levels
* You are customer focused ensuring that your messaging and communications resonates with the target audience generating quality leads and long lasting relationships
* You are a self-starter who thrives on working independently with small cross functional teams and is comfortable with working remotely from the central business
* You have excellent communication and written skills and enjoy creating and editing great content
* You’re able to work across multiple teams and manage both agencies and freelancers
* German mother tongue and fluent in English mandatory, French or Spanish knowledge a plus

_Our team comes from a variety of backgrounds, and we embrace diversity – if you’re unsure, please apply._
